game.name: 1 - Dragon Warrior (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: A nation just over a rebellion by their own psychic soldiers is attacked by an alien being in a giant star ship.

game.name: 10 - Legend of Zelda, The (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: This is probably the best Zelda hack out there. Almost every single thing possible to modify in the game has been modified. This hack exemplifies the talented individuals in our community. Anybody even remotely interested in ROMhacking should give this one a try!

game.name: 1002 - Battle City (J) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of the original classic on the NES, Battle City. All 35 levels have been completely redone to make a new experience, while the palette changes make the games have a new look. The title screen has also been changed to match the name.

game.name: 1005 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: Welcome to the 4th installment of my NEW series. More of the same madness you know and love. Originally, this hack was going to be a full game on one file, but was split into a Part 1/Part 2 format because I wanted to experiment with showcase levels I made about two years ago. This game doesn’t really need an explanation. More repeated levels, custom levels and now showcase levels. Hope you all enjoy.

game.name: 1007 - New Ghostbusters II (E) [!]
game.info: Poor Ernie Hudson does not have much luck when it comes to the Ghostbusters franchise, including being turned green for this game. Let’s fix that up, shall we?

game.name: 101 - Megaman II (U) [!]
game.info: Despite the name this is actually a Mega Man 2 hack, which translates it back into Japanese and adds a ton of cool features. To put it simply, this is a new Mega Man 2, the only things that still exist from the original are the robot masters, and even they’ve been changed in terms of fighting style.

game.name: 1010 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: The 3rd installment of my NEW series for SMB3. This installment has changed the series as a whole. For the first time since unsuccessful hacks made, I’ve attempted a full ROM and succeeded. Also what’s new to the series is that this game now has modified graphics to bring the game to life more a bit. As for the levels, nothing new once again. More repeated levels and custom levels. Enjoy guys.

game.name: 1011 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: SUPER MARIO BROS Special X1 for NES is a altered version of the Super Mario Bros. Special for NES hack which was created by Frantik and Karatorian. It is altered to more closely resemble the X1 version of Super Mario Bros. Special. The changes found in the hack include:

game.name: 1012 - New Ghostbusters II (E) [!]
game.info: After making a patch to recolor the Ghostbusters to allow Winston a more natural skin tone, many other alterations were made in an attempt to make an already great game even better.

game.name: 1013 - Tetris (U) [b7]
game.info: This is a 2 player hack for the NES version of Tetris. In order to accomplish this, the ROM was converted from MMC1 to MMC3. The PRG was expanded to have 2 additional PRG banks.

game.name: 1014 - VS. Super Mario Bros. (VS)
game.info: This is a hack of Vs. Super Mario Bros. that allows the game to be run on a standard MMC1 cart with 8KB SRAM. No custom hardware required!

game.name: 1016 - Tiny Toon Adventures (U) [!]
game.info: Super Mario Adventures is a ROM hack of Tiny Toon Adventures. It changes many of the sprites to Mario universe sprites making the game like a Mario game. This was done as the game was felt to be highly inspired by the Mario series in it’s gameplay and design. All four characters have been changed to Mario in differnent forms of Transformations. The story has also been altered to use President/King Koopa from the SMB movie instead of Montana Max. Other characters have also been changed to characters found in the Mario universe such as Peach and Toad.

game.name: 102 - Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]
game.description: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]
game.info: It’s about time Error, the stationary resident of the town of Ruto from Nintendo’s Zelda II, embarked on an adventure of his own and left that pointy-eared Link behind!

patch.name: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!].ips

rom.name: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!].nes

game.name: 1026 - Rockman (J) [!]
game.info: This game requires the Japanese Rockman 1 ROM. Not Mega Man.

game.name: 103 - Megaman II (U) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of Capcom’s Mega Man 2 for the NES. The hack isn’t a complete remake of the original game, but all levels have been changed to look different from the original ones. The colors have also been changed, and a new title screen has been made.

game.name: 1030 - Mike Tyson's Punch-Out!! (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: This is a hack which replaces the opponents with characters from other games including the arcade version of Punch-out, Super Punch-out, among other games. The referee has been replaced by Wario and the floor tarp has been recolored. The text has been modified to reflect the new content. Little Mac’s trainer has been replaced by Von Kaiser. This hack is based off a trailer called “Team Awesome´s Punch-Out!! Trailer”.

game.name: 1031 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: The 5th and final installment in my NEW series. This is Mario’s last original/new adventure. Don’t be sad yet because this game is two files. One is the main game while the other is a Lost Levels game, so it is more fun to have.

game.name: 1032 - Castlevania II - Simon's Quest (U) [!]
game.info: This is an English re-Translation of Castlevania II: Simon’s Quest. In additon to translating the ROM, an in-game map is added, and the Japanese staff credits were re-added to the game. The patch is for the NES version.

game.name: 104 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: This is one of those rare SMB hacks out there that have a lot of replay value. The object is to find stars in order to reach Bowser’s castle, this is a fun hack that will most definitely keep you busy. And the music in this hack is really good too. The spikes can kill you in an instant, so be careful. If you like SMB hacks then this game is right up your alley…

game.name: 1054 - Rockman 3 - Dr. Wily no Saigo! (J) [!]
game.info: This is a ROM hack of Megaman 3. It is based off the Japanese version called Rockman 3 - Dr. Wily no Saigo!. It changes the levels and graphics and maybe more!

game.name: 1061 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: This is a ROM hack of Megaman 2. It is based off the Japanese version called Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo. It changes the levels and graphics and maybe more!

game.name: 108 - Atlantis no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: This is just a graphics hack to give Atlantis No Nazo a Mario feel. Watch out, this game is really difficult to begin with. One hit and you die, the object of the game is to make it to the last level (didn’t see that one coming, lol) but you can get lost in this game. You’ll find that the gameplay is really tight like an 1980’s platformer, just keep your sanity while playing this hack. Don’t take my word for it, try it for yourself…

game.name: 1082 - Rockman 5 - Blues no Wana! (J) [!]
game.info: Rockman Cross X is a hack for Rockman 5: Blues no Wana (not the overseas version, Mega Man 5) that changes the game into a boss-rush type with very little focus on platforming. All the bosses have been rewritten, giving each one new attacks not seen yet.

game.name: 1084 - Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]
game.description: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]
game.info: This hack adjusts the difficulty of Zelda II to make it more playable. As we all know, this game is very difficult to complete, to the point where it is frustrating to play through it and is not even fun due to the high difficulty. That is where this hack comes into play.

patch.name: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!].ips

rom.name: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!].nes

game.name: 1089 - Bomberman (J) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of Bomberman for the Nintendo Entertainment System. It changes the sprites, other graphics, and palettes to make the game Wario Blast themed. According to the author the hack acts as a prequel to the Gameboy game Wario Blast. This hack stars only Wario and does not feature Bomberman.

game.name: 1092 - Battle City (J) [!]
game.info: This is a pretty basic hack of Battle City for NES. Changes include graphics, text and a select few stage layouts. Mostly, it was just a random idea executed as a result of insomnia.

game.name: 1093 - Megaman III (U) [!]
game.info: This is actually a combination of two hacks with a little extra in between.

game.name: 110 - Megaman (U) [!]
game.info: Dr. Wily finally concedes that Mega Man may be too much for his evil robotic creations. Determined to get the best of the blue bomber, Dr. Wily contacts another famous villain, Bowser! Having combined their forces, Dr Wily and Bowser unleash their new destructive creations upon the Mushroom Kingdom. After hearing news of Wily’s new plan, Mega Man decides to travel to the Mushroom Kingdom himself to stop Wily again. Mega Man now finds himself in a strange new world filled with obstacles and locales very foreign to him. Fearless, Mega Man presses on to Super Mario’s old stomping grounds to defeat these new foes.

game.name: 1100 - Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]
game.description: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]
game.info: “Zelda II Master Quest” is an amazing Zelda II (NES) hack that will give a second life to this classic masterpiece! Give it a try!

patch.name: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!].ips

rom.name: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!].nes

game.name: 1102 - Makai Island (U) (Prototype)
game.info: This hack changes and fixes a few things in this game, here’s what it does to it:

game.name: 1103 - DuckTales (USA)
game.info: This hack changes and fixes a bunch of things, here’s what it does to it:

game.name: 1106 - Astyanax (U) [!]
game.info: Here’s the classic NES game Astyanax as I think it ought to be. Read the included guide for details, or just play the game and see for yourself.

game.name: 1107 - Castlevania (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: This is a rom hack I made based off of Luto Akino’s hack called CastleVania Overflow Darkness. I had his permission to do so. I pretty much re-did all the stages and their graphics. I did, however, keep most of Luto’s enemy designs and attack patterns, his cool looking Simon’s sprite, his castle introduction sequence(I did change the castle, tho) and his ending screen(Which is awesome) since these were the reasons why I wanted to do this in the first place. However, any other new graphics you’ll see were most likely done by myself.

game.name: 1112 - Megaman II (U) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of Capcom’s Mega Man II for the NES. It is a level edit of the game. This hack changes the levels in the game in some sort of way except for Quickman’s stage and Wily 5 (because it’s just a boss rush).

game.name: 1119 - Double Dragon (U) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of Double Dragon for the NES. It makes the game easier by reducing the energy of enemies, increasing the energy the player has, and modifying damage done and received to/from enemies. It should help out anyone who finds this game too difficult to enjoy, because this is a hard game.

game.name: 1120 - Double Dragon II - The Revenge (USA)
game.info: This is a hack for the NES version of Double Dragon II: The Revenge. It makes the game easier by lowering the energy of enemies, increasing the player’s energy, and adjusting the damage done/received to/from enemies. It should be helpful to those who find this game too difficult to enjoy, because this is a hard game.

game.name: 1121 - Double Dragon III - The Sacred Stones (U) [!]
game.description: Double Dragon III - The Sacred Stones (U) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of Double Dragon III: The Sacred Stones for the NES. It makes the game easier by increasing the players health, increasing weapon uses, decreasing the enemies health, and adjusting damage done to enemies. It should be helpful to players who find this game too difficult to enjoy, because this is a very hard game.

patch.name: Double Dragon III - The Sacred Stones (U) [!].ips

rom.name: Double Dragon III - The Sacred Stones (U) [!].nes

game.name: 1122 - Rockman (J) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of the JP version of Megaman called Rockman. It modifies the level layouts.

game.name: 1123 - Rockman (J) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of the JP version of Megaman called Rockman.

game.name: 1124 - Rockman (J) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of the JP version of Megaman called Rockman.

game.name: 1125 - Uncanny X-Men, The (U) [!]
game.info: These patches allow players to pick & choose from a number of ‘easy mods’ which include reducing the magnet freeze times, having an invincible CPU partner, or disabling the second player entirely for a single player mode.

game.name: 1127 - Rockman (J) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of the JP version of Megaman called Rockman. The hack changes the level design, palette, and graphics. It is a parody of a Megaman-inspired game for PC called MegaMari. Info on the PC game can be found here.

game.name: 1128 - Ice Climber (USA, Europe, Korea)
game.info: This hack restores the seal enemy that was taken out of the American version and replaced with a yeti back to it.

game.name: 113 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: This is a semi-sequel (or more like an expansion pack) for the author’s previous hack, Final Fantasy ++^ (so if you haven’t played that, then you probably shouldn’t be playing this). At any rate, this is quite a bit harder to beat than FF++, so n00bs beware. Also, one can consider this sort of a tribute to classic SquareEnix (the way they were…). It includes adaptations of various dungeons from FFs 3, 4, 5, & 6, SaGa 2 (a.k.a. FF Legend 2), and Dragon Quest 5 (along with a couple of new ones). And, of course, lots of classic FF enemies are here for you to battle.

game.name: 1131 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of the JP version of Megaman 2, called Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo. It changes the level layout and graphics. Also changed is the music, which even includes some tracks from Double Dragon NES. Also included is other patches: Wild Version and Wild Version Boss Only. These alter the game further.

game.name: 1132 - Rockman (J) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of the JP version of Megaman called Rockman.Rockman TP is a boss rush version of Rockman 1. The game is a similar boss rush Mega Man 1 hack called Mega Man Showdown.

game.name: 1134 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: This is a hack for the JP version of Megaman called Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo. The hack changes the weapons, bosses (not sprites), level graphics, and level layout.

game.name: 1135 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of the JP version of Megaman 2 called Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo. It changes the weapons, boss behavior, and level design. Included are two additional patches for any version of Rockman 2 which remove the main weapon use and start the player with all special weapons. An additonal patch starts the player off with less special weapon energy. Secondary patches do not apply Yendor Code’s changes, and thus can be used on any copy of RM2.

game.name: 114 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Mushroom Nightmare is a hack of the classic game, Super Mario Brothers. It features completely revamped graphics, along with major level editing throughout the game. It also features a new storyline, as the brothers aren’t trying to save the Princess anymore, it’s the Chancellor they’re after.

game.name: 1141 - Megaman III (U) [!]
game.info: This is a graphic hack of the US version of Megaman III. It replaces the main sprite with Riddler and the bosses with characters from the Batman Universe.

game.name: 1142 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of the JP version of Megaman 2 called Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo. The hack changes the weapons, boss behavior & palette, and level design.

game.name: 1143 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of the JP version of Megaman 2 called Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo. It changes the weapons, bosses, and level designs.

game.name: 1144 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of the JP version of Megaman 2 called Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo. It changes the weapons, boss behavior, and level designs.

game.name: 1145 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of the JP version of Megaman 2 called Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo. It shortens levels so that bosses are encountered almost immediately. It also seems to change some boss behavior.

game.name: 1148 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: This is a map edit for the original Metroid. Screens, enemy and item placement, palettes, text, and more are all changed. The primary goal was to make the game more playable - the discerning player will note the careful placement of platforms and enemies to make jumps easier. However, beating the game will not be a cinch. Items are much more difficult to get, corridors are contorted into winding mazes, and many of the energy tanks have been completely eliminated.

game.name: 1149 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of Metroid that includes level changes and a modified palette.

game.name: 115 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: The author’s intent is to enhance the overall playability of the Metroid engine by providing an entirely new adventure. The author have attempted to keep this version of Metroid true to the spirit of the original by making some tricky secrets and convoluted mazes.

game.name: 1151 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: Converts regular NES looking Samus into Super NES looking Samus!

game.name: 1153 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of the original game Metroid. It still preserves the best of Metroid but gets a new twist that still feels much like the original. The game still uses the same rooms as in the original Metroid. but with a completely different map. The brother game to Metroid Adventure, Super Metroid 8-Bit uses the same map (basically) but different rooms themed after rooms in Super Metroid.

game.name: 1154 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: This is a complete hack for the NES game Metroid in which you play once again as Samus who has been captured by the Space Pirates only to escape and achieve victory! The level layout has completely changed and the level graphics have all been changed as well. Please refer to the read-me for more information.

game.name: 1155 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: This is a 95% graphics hack of the NES game, “Metroid.” There are minor level layout adjustments also. The game features Link (instead of Samus in suit) and a slightly modified Kid Icarus (instead of Samus out of suit). The enemies vary from games like Zelda 2, SMB 2, SMB 3, Megaman, and a few others.

game.name: 1158 - Bomberman (U) [!]
game.info: The purpose of this modification is to produce a game and manual that would more accurately meet the expectations brought upon by the original NES cover art.

game.name: 1159 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of the JP version of Megaman 2 called Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo. It changes the graphics and level designs of levels.

game.name: 116 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: 100% of graphics updated to look more like SMB3/SMW. There are no other changes, so you can mix and match this with level mods and other features.

game.name: 1160 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a patch that gives full level hacks for Rockman 2

game.name: 1161 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a full level hack for Rock Man 2.

game.name: 1162 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of the JP version of Megaman 2 called Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo. It changes the layout of levels.

game.name: 1163 - Rockman 3 - Dr. Wily no Saigo! (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a full level hack for Rockman 3.

game.name: 1164 - Rockman 3 - Dr. Wily no Saigo! (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a complete level hack for Rockman 3.

game.name: 1166 - Megaman III (U) [!]
game.info: Here is a full level hack for Mega Man III. Some sprites, stage palettes and design were altered a bit, and the stage music are reshuffled.

game.name: 1167 - Rockman 3 - Dr. Wily no Saigo! (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a complete level hack for Rock Man 3. All the levels have been changed as well as the level graphics. Also this hack uses the music from DurfarC’s hack called MM3: The Battle of Gamma.

game.name: 117 - Legend of Zelda, The (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: All of the graphics are updated to look more like A Link to the Past/Oracle Series. Other changes (item names) kept minimal so this can be mixed and matched with other level mods. Font optimized for PocketNES.

game.name: 1170 - Megaman III (U) [!]
game.info: Here are 2 full level hacks for Mega Man III (Powa & Powa II).

game.name: 1172 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: This is hack for Rock Man 2.

game.name: 1173 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a complete level hack for Rock Man 2. All the levels have been change and some graphical changes have been made as well. This ROM patch is meant for the Rock Man 2 ROM. If applying to a Mega Man II ROM, please apply at your own risk. Included in this ZIP are 2 patches. One is the original patch and the other is the PLUS version which has increased difficulty.

game.name: 1174 - Rockman 4 - Aratanaru Yabou!! (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a complete hack for Rock Man 4. All levels have been changed and there are graphical changes as well. This patch is meant for the Rock Man 4 ROM. If you use on the Mega Man IV ROM, please use at your own risk.

game.name: 1175 - Rockman 4 - Aratanaru Yabou!! (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a full game hack. All the levels have been edited and there are graphical changes as well. This patch was originally intended for Rock Man 4. If you plan on applying to Mega Man IV, please use at your own risk.

game.name: 1176 - Rockman 5 - Blues no Wana! (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a complete ROM hack that features all new levels and graphics changes for Rock Man 5. This patch was intended for Rock Man 5. If you plan on applying to Mega Man V please be aware of possible risks.

game.name: 1177 - Rockman 5 - Blues no Wana! (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a complete hack for Rockman 5. All the stages have been edited, some new graphics, and the entire game has new music. Also included is an interesting feature you can do. You can now slide not just on the ground but in mid-air, as well! In addition to the main patch are 2 patches that you can apply alone to a Rockman 5 ROM if you just want the Air Sliding ability only. This is intended for Rockman 5. Please be aware of risk if you apply to a Mega Man V ROM.

game.name: 1178 - Rockman 5 - Blues no Wana! (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a complete level hack for Rockman 5. All the levels have been changed and some graphics as well. This patch is intended for Rockman 5. If you plan to apply this to a Mega Man V ROM, please be aware of risks.

game.name: 1179 - Rockman 5 - Blues no Wana! (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a complete level hack for Rockman 5 as well as some graphical changes to the game as well. This patch is intended for Rockman 5. If you are applying to a Mega Man V ROM, please be aware there may be risks.

game.name: 1181 - Rockman 6 - Shijou Saidai no Tatakai!! (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a full game hack for Rockman 6. All the levels have been edited as well as some graphical changes as well. This patch is intended for the Rockman 6 ROM. If applying to a Mega Man VI ROM, please be aware they may be risks to that ROM.

game.name: 1182 - Rockman 6 - Shijou Saidai no Tatakai!! (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a full game hack that changes all levels, some graphics, and some boss & weapon behaviors a bit. Included is a Main Patch which does all of the above, a patch that only does the weapons & boss behaviors, and a patch that only has just the level changes just in case you want one or the other or all. This patch is intended for Rockman 6. If you apply to Mega Man VI, please be aware of the risk of ROM corruption.

game.name: 1183 - Rockman 4 - Aratanaru Yabou!! (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a complete level hack for Rock Man IV. All levels have been changed. This patch is meant for applying to the Rockman 4 - Aratanaru Yabou!!. Apply to a Mega Man IV English ROM at your own risk.

game.name: 1184 - Rockman 6 - Shijou Saidai no Tatakai!! (J) [!]
game.info: This is a complete hack for the game Rockman 6. Here is what has been done with this patch:

game.name: 1186 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: This hack replaces Metroid’s password system with a saving system, offering three save files. The file selection menu shows the player’s equipment, and as an added bonus, the player’s health is now saved (no need to grind for health every time you resume your game). The save system can be a handy addition for those who don’t like to use save-states, or those playing on a flash-cart.

game.name: 1193 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: This is the Pandamar version of Super Mario Bros that changes the music and graphics, making Mario look like a panda. His appearance may have inspired the 20X6 character of “Pan Pan” from Homestar Runner.

game.name: 121 - Rockman 5 - Blues no Wana! (J) [!]
game.info: This modification replaces certain character sprites to make them look more like Rockman 7 (Rockman’s stand animation, Blues, some of Dr.Wily’s and Dr.Right’s sprites).

game.name: 122 - River City Ransom (U) [!]
game.info: Someone has cloned the evil doctor John Harvey Kellogg (the cereal guy, see road to wellville to get all the jokes) and now its up to famous actor Wilford Brimley (quaker oats commercials,”our house” “coccoon” and “the firm”) to stop his cereal empire!

game.name: 1229 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of Super Mario Bros. which replaces Mario and Luigi with Peach and Daisy as the playable characters. Rather than reusing or editing any existing sprites, the new graphics were made from scratch and specifically designed to fit in with the aesthetic of the original game. Inspired by Mike Mika’s Donkey Kong: Pauline Edition, this hack is directed toward the ideal of giving women more active, heroic, playable roles in games.

game.name: 1230 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: Final Fantasy Revolution is a complete overhaul of Final Fantasy 1, featuring new graphics, classes, magic, and a rewritten script.

game.name: 1232 - Strider (U) [!]
game.info: This is a palette and text hack of Strider where you can play the final boss. The text has been changed to tell his side of the story.

game.name: 1235 - Tecmo Super Bowl (U) [!]
game.info: This patch updates state, players, playbooks, and teams for the 2004 season.

game.name: 124 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This hack features new level designs, some changed graphics and palettes, and text changes. It’s very difficult, so play it if you’re looking for a challenge.

game.name: 1240 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: ‘Roidz is a graphical re-tooling of the original Metroid, in similar fashion to MDbTroid, but with it’s own style and aesthetic. This hack features all new sprites and updated background graphics, new animations, and a couple of other small treats that help breath new life into this classic game.

game.name: 126 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Now this one is interesting! While most of the levels are the same the physics themselves have been changed, gravity is much lower and the longer you hold the jump button the shorter your jumps. The fireballs have been replaced by laser beams, rendering them useless against short enemies on the ground. For whatever reason the water levels have been edited, making them almost impossible to complete.

game.name: 1263 - Baseball Simulator 1.000 (USA)
game.info: Baseball Simulator 2013 updates Culture Brain’s Baseball Simulator 1.000 with 18 current MLB teams:

game.name: 1269 - Darkwing Duck (U) [!]
game.info: This is a Darkwing Duck hack which adds a new additional extra level with new boss - Negaduck, it can be playing after finishing all regular levels.

game.name: 1276 - Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]

game.info: All dialouge changed.

game.name: 1278 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: Final Fantasy Zz is a much more difficult version of Final Fantasy with a few enhancements designed to make the game more enjoyable and much more challenging. While Final Fantasy Zz is largely true to the original Final Fantasy, this hack contains multiple bugfixes, such as fixing the critical hit bug, the Black Belt armor bug, and some cosmetic bugs. There are also some improvements, such as the ability to buy 9 Heal Potions at a time, the ability to see what’s in a treasure chest without taking the item if your inventory is full, new magic spells, a slightly redesigned map, rebalanced classes, a few new monsters, and the ability to dash by holding the B-button. Many enemies have altered stats and some have new special attacks. For those of you who have beaten Final Fantasy 1, this hack should help spice up an old favorite and keep you on the edge of your seat! You won’t ever want to play the original Final Fantasy again after giving FFZz a try!

game.name: 1279 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]

game.name: 1292 - Adventures in the Magic Kingdom (U) [!]

game.name: 1293 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: Many years ago there was a very cool hack called “Mario Fantasy Adventure”, which was apparently originally made by Acmlm. However, while there was some awesome music and graphic work done on the hack, the hack was unfinished and the changes only lasted up until the first temple.

game.name: 1296 - Squashed (U) (Prototype) [!]

game.name: 13 - Castlevania (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: Castlevania Retold is–as the name suggest–a retelling of the original NES Castlevania. I wanted to keep the original story intact (Many of the CV games are retellings of the first one, this is no different) but offer new levels and graphics, this is just that. All the levels have the same themes to them they originally had, but with new layouts and enemy placement, I also wanted to keep the classic feel to it, which is why I used mostly graphics from CV2 and 3. There are very few custom graphics in the hack, I’m not good with graphics at all, but I did make a new title screen using the new CV logo (Which Moonchile later enhanced) and enhanced some of the orignal sprits. Any Castlevania fan will probably like this, but until recently I didn’t notice it’s one downside: It’s hard. As I made this hack I pretty much learned how everything in CV’s game engine works, the exact timing of enemies and such. So, while I can play through most of it with no problems even my friends who are good at Castlevania die several times on the first level. (Sorry about the short review, I suck at these kind of things…)

game.name: 132 - Megaman II (U) [!]
game.info: This is one of those Mega Man 2 hacks that just has to be played, for one the whole soundtrack is changed! The challenge is very good and all of the graphics has been changed to give this hack some extra flavor. There are graphics from other games too but that’s a surprise. Mega Man fans will get a kick out of this hack as much as everyone else will enjoy it. Infidelity did a really good job with this hack and it shows, so what are you waiting for? Download this hack and get ready for an all new adventure of Mega Man 2. :D

game.name: 137 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: Wart is Back! The evil king has escaped from Super Mario’s unconscious and invaded the Mushroom Kingdom. Wart has kidnapped Mario and rendered the kingdom defenseless. Princess Peach has sent for Samus in a last-chance hope that she may be able to defeat Wart and save the land. As Samus, you must traverse the many obstacles and dangers that Wart has set up throughout the 5 areas as well as collect Mario’s super powers to help you on your journey.

game.name: 138 - Double Dragon (U) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of Double Dragon for the NES. What I have been trying to do was make the NES version a bit more authentic to the Arcade original. I changed a few graphics that I felt didn’t really fit in or changed them to look like something from the original. I also changed palettes to look like the original. Probably the biggest palette change you will notice is the final level. It is white by default, but the arcade was goldish. So I changed the whole level to be that palette.

game.name: 1394 - Super Mario Bros. 2 (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: After failing to defeat Mario and his friends in the dream world of Sub-Con, Wart has set his sights on a new target: a small, seemingly defenseless planet called Blobaria. As the entire world falls under Wart’s evil spell, it’s up to Blobby and his three trusted companions to track down the wicked wizard and put a stop to his evil plans once and for all!

game.name: 1399 - Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]
game.description: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]
game.info: It’s the original game but with a twist. Link can’t jump! While the world map and dungeon layouts are mostly unchanged, they have been designed with no jumping in mind. Included in the download is a Hard mode, Easy mode, and an Easy Mode with jumping enabled so you can play normally.

game.name: 140 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Mario decided it was time for a vacation, so he went to the Tofu Kingdom for some rest and relaxation. One of the sites he was going to visit first was a famous play where the most beautiful Geisha in all the land performs. When Mario buys his ticket he notices a big ball of light coming from the sky and crashes right into the hall where he was going to watch the play. When Mario arrives at the hall he sees people running out in a panic and some people already dead in a massacre. When Bowser sees that Mario is at the Tofu Kingdom he takes the famous Geisha along with her three uncles, and flies away into the sky. One of her other uncles was lying on the floor and tells Mario that Bowser has gone into the Exile Valley, he also warns Mario that people who went there has never returned. So before he dies, he gives Mario a map where the Valley is located. So now Mario is in a new land, with a new quest, while he’s on vacation…

Thus, I decided to hack in some graphics from SMB3. I think it makes the game much more bearable, and I hope you think so too.

game.name: 1711 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: Using Lenophis’ Battle DTE Fixer-upper as a base, this project places Final Fantasy’s text in proper case, and also greatly expands enemy names. Character graphics have been slightly tweaked–mostly to fix graphical glitches–and several particular weapons no longer share the same palettes.

game.name: 1715 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: Grandma got ran over by a reindeer and it’s up to Grandpa to find the culprit. Is it really Santa behind the attack or someone else? Grandpa uses his wife’s medications to become Super Grandpa and Poinsettias to release his rage.

game.name: 1716 - Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Twas the night before Christmas,

game.name: 1717 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: This is Super Mario Bros: Time And Place. In this variation inspired by the “Time and Place” world from Braid, time stands still when Mario stands still and speeds up when Mario speeds up. It took me ages to code this darned thing, so be sure you check out all of the strange new behaviours that result from this temporospatial anomaly. Like the balance-lift platforms, for instance.

game.name: 1718 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: In this hack, Mario’s jump has been reduced to one block high - the jump height he had in Donkey Kong. To permit Mario to clear the levels, several changes were made, such as reducing the height of pipes, the addition of bottomless pits to inescapable holes, and lowering the platforms in the sky stages. Only the most necessary changes were made - most of the levels’ geography is unaffected.

game.name: 1719 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: This ROM hack replaces daytime with deep sunset. The graphics are reduced to black outlines over strong colour. It has a few interesting ramifications - for one, the hills and bushes of the overworld suddenly become disguises and concealments for walking enemies.

game.name: 1720 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: This hack is identical to the original game, but the enemies are slightly faster than normal. This includes the powerups and moving platforms, too. It’s interesting how this physics tweak causes the ‘feel’ of certain levels to change - 2-2 and 6-2, for instance, seem much more hectic and hostile.

game.name: 1721 - Mario Bros. (W) [!]

This game is part of the Year of Luigi, a tribute made to the greatest Player 2 in videogame history. A classic with a clever and modern touch. It also includes a patch for Mario Bros. Classic (E).

game.info: This hack basically ports levels from Game Boy Lolo to Adventures of Lolo 3, because GB Lolo is horribly slow, looks and sounds bad and its just not fun to play. It includes 95% of levels, as because of limitations of Lolo 3 some early levels are missing(only around 20 or so) but all other levels(+pro levels) are in.

game.name: 180 - Super Mario Bros. 2 (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of the original SMB2 game with new levels. The idea behind this hack is that it’s the same SMB2 game we all love, but with entirely new levels. Game difficulty is easy to moderate but rises from moderate to nightmare for worlds 6 and 7. Ain’t that nice?

game.name: 1801 - Sunman (Europe) (Proto)
game.info: This is the complete conversion of the game Sunman for the NES to the game it was originally meant to be, Superman. The graphics have been changed to that of the Superman rom, as well as the title screen and cutscenes. Download and Enjoy!!!

game.name: 181 - Castlevania (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: Here’s a Castlevania hack that was released February, 5th 2005. Dr. Mario remade the graphics and levels to give Castlevania a different feel. Fans of Castlevania will like this hack, and everyone else should give it a shot. So what are you waiting for? Play it now.

game.name: 182 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: Originally, this started as a script and graphics improvement by Phin. However, I took the project under my wing and developed on it further, adding a whole new script, bug fixes, even more graphical improvements and a few changes to game balance. Enjoy!

game.name: 1873 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: This hack was created to celebrate the entire year of Luigi.

game.name: 188 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This is a hack found on a Japanese site which does a pretty good job of hiding the fact it’s a regular Mario Game. It changes the music, graphics, and level structure to be a bit unlike your normal Mario game. While it is relatively short, it is pretty fun while it lasts.

game.name: 191 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Toad’s Treasure Quest is my latest SMB 1 romhack. The foundation of this romhack is what makes it special and very fun to play. A fellow romhacker, Googie, put together a rom containing hacks from various open-source Japanese SMB hacks. He then changed all the GFX and sent me the file for a collaboration project. That project ended up dieing unfortunately. But after a couple months, I found myself with some free time and decided to make a new SMB hack using this incredible hack as a starting point.

game.name: 192 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This is an old SMB hack that was being worked on by Challenge Games back in 1999 to 2002 (you can find the old demo at Zophar’s Domain) This hack was long forgotten and someone needed to finish it, so here it is. There’s also a HTM file with this patch that talks about this hack from the original authors.

game.name: 193 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: Here’s Blue Mario Bros. 3, this hack was started back in the spring of 2005. This hack almost died but with the help of beneficii and Googie this hack is complete. I hope everyone enjoys this hack, it was being worked on for a long time (few months)

game.name: 1935 - Mega Man 2 (USA)
game.info: What the hack contains:

game.name: 1936 - Pro Wrestling (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: With the launch of the new WWE Network last week, now you can enjoy some WWE action on the NES!!! This hack changes all of the Wrestlers on the Pro Wrestling game for NES to WWE Wrestlers. Lots of palette hacking, as well as the intro and the ring itself. This new version has fixed all of the wrestlers and improved a couple of graphical issues. Enjoy!

game.name: 1941 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: Challenge your princess saving skills with all new levels that have a fair amount of difficulty.

game.name: 196 - Bubble Bobble (U) [!]
game.info: Graphics have been changed, and all 100 levels have been edited. Music has also been improved. It’s a new adventure for both Bub and Bob.

game.name: 1970 - Hogan's Alley (W) [!]
game.info: Also title known as “Grand Shoot”, based on Hogan’s Alley for the NES with improved palettes, graphics and text. You must avoid to shoot the good guys with Grandos Plex, Trixie Coyote and Grandomon Rabbit, then shoot the bad guys with Helster Cat, Dragon Doger and Gary Gangster.

game.name: 1972 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: Simple patch that removes the redundant steps forward & back when assigning commands to a Warrior. Requires CaptainMuscles’ original patch to be applied as well (patching order shouldn’t matter).

game.name: 1974 - Metroid (USA)
game.info: Metroid Automap adds a corner map to the game similar to the one found in Super Metroid.

game.name: 1975 - Metroid (USA)
game.info: Samus can now wall jump like she can in Super Metroid

game.name: 1976 - Ghostbusters (USA)
game.info: This hack replaces with new typefaces, “Press START” blinking text in the title screen, better text alignment, and fixes proofreading for Ghostbusters for the NES.

game.name: 1985 - Moai-kun (J)
game.info: You’ve been captured by the pigs and while you fight your way out, and you gotta rescue your fellow birds that been taken prisoners! What a story!

game.name: 1987 - Rockman 5 - Blues no Wana! (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a hack for Rockman 5 which changes the level layouts and adds a degree of difficulty to the game.

game.name: 1988 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: This hack is the combination of three individual hacks. It was created to be the ultimate NES remake of a classic game.

game.name: 1989 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: This is a ROM hack of Final Fantasy (NES), so that the Light Warriors are all female. At its core, the character graphics are redrawn anew (along with some other graphics); in addition, some of the NPC dialogue is changed to reflect different perceptions of this fact in a realistically subtle way. However, the actual gameplay (plotline, class abilities, enemies, etc) remains the same, intentionally.

game.name: 199 - Blaster Master (U) [!]
game.info: Blaster Master: Pimp your Ride, is an assembly hack for the NES platformer Blaster Master. Changes to most of the areas are minor save for areas 1 and 2 tank section, which are re-done. The changes are made to utilize the full effect of the ASM hack, and premise of this hack which is the 8 new additional upgardes the tank can get.

game.name: 1990 - Baseball Simulator 1.000 (USA)
game.info: Baseball Simulator 2014 updates Culture Brain’s Baseball Simulator 1.000 with 18 current MLB teams:

game.name: 1992 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: Updates for Version 1.1

game.name: 1993 - Legend of Zelda, The (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: This hack came about out of frustration with the hack it’s based on, Zelda Challenge Outlands for Legend Of Zelda on the NES.

game.name: 20 - Tecmo Super Bowl (U) [!]
game.info: This is a Dynasty WLAF and USFL Tecmo Super Bowl edit for NES.

game.name: 200 - Bugs Bunny Crazy Castle, The (USA)
game.info: This is the first hack ever to change the levels of The Bugs Bunny Crazy Castle, for the NES. The first, and the best! All 60 stages are changed, including the 4 special stages. The game starts pretty easy, but gets quite difficult by the end!

game.name: 201 - Adventures of Lolo (U) [!]
game.info: This hack modifies the game Adventures of Lolo. Features 50 new rooms, some sprites changed to the Lolo 2/3 ones, some palette changes, and some text changes.

game.name: 2015 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (Japan)
game.info: This patch will turn Japanese Rockman 2 (Famicom) from the MMC1 to the MMC6 mapper.

game.name: 202 - Adventures of Lolo 2 (U) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of Adventures of Lolo 2. Just like Challenging Lolo, it features 54 new levels, palette changes, and a few graphics changed.

game.name: 2027 - Rockman (J) [!]
game.info: This patch will turn Japanese Rockman (Famicom) from the MMC1 to the MMC6 mapper.

game.name: 2032 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Here is a hack for Super Mario Bros. which changes the playing style of Super Mario Bros. where instead of running through a level and stomping enemies you have to be tactical in avoiding enemies.

game.name: 205 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Super Mario Bash includes all new levels (all 8 worlds) and new graphics. I find most Mario hacks to be too hard (by making them super-hard they get away with only changing world 1…), and not actually fun, like it’s supposed to be. So my levels are more like what you’d find in a real Mario game.

game.name: 2054 - Arkanoid (U) [!]
game.info: Here is a hack for Arkanoid that re-creates 35 of the 50 levels featured in Sega’s “Riddle of Pythagoras” Arkanoid clone.

game.name: 2059 - Arkanoid (U) [!]
game.info: A full ROM hack meant to take full advantage of what Arkalavista could do. It includes several new levels, new graphics, and a speedup patch that doubles the Vaus’ (paddle’s) speed by 2x, making it slightly more playable without the Arkanoid Vaus controller (which only a handful of emulators support)

game.name: 2062 - Arkanoid (U) [!]
game.info: Here is a ROM hack for Arkanoid with levels based around Chinese themes, originally it was made on a Chinese-language Japanese ROM for Arkanoid that was missing the second graphics bank needed for the DOH battle at the end of the game. To make it more stable, it has since been relocated to a US ROM with a few additional upgrades. It is now in full English, the levels are slightly altered, and it is now possible to have a black block.

game.name: 2064 - Baseball Stars (USA)
game.info: This hack changes many things including boosted stats, updated and new team logos, new team colors, new fonts, and replaced the worst team (SNK Crushers) with a new team more challenging than the upgraded American Dreams. Please see the readme file for the whole story.

game.name: 2067 - Super Mario Bros. 2 (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: This patch rewrites the story text and fixes typos and mix-ups in the credits. See the README for a full list of changes.

game.name: 2068 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: Super Mario Bros. 3Mix is a large-scale hack that changes and adds lots of features to Super Mario Bros. 3, and pays homage to many past and (relative) FUTURE Mario titles, while attempting to remain faithful in spirit to the look and feel of Super Mario Bros. 3.

game.name: 207 - Summer Carnival '92 - Recca (J) [!]
game.info: Most people don’t know that there are alternate modes of the game Recca, which are accessed by very obscure means.

game.name: 2070 - Legend of Zelda, The (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: MZELDA (LEGEND OF ZELDA - NES) (HACKED BY MAKO GESHER)

game.name: 2075 - Dig Dug (J) [!]
game.info: Dig Dug Redug was DragonDePlatino’s first hack, made over the course of 4 days. A complete graphical overhaul of the NES version of Dig Dug, this hack changes all the graphics and palettes to be a lot more detailed. It also makes the characters a bit larger and adds more detail to the caves. Enjoy!

game.name: 209 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Here’s a hack that Dr. Mario made in 2003 when Tek Hacks used to be around, he gives SMB a Zelda feel. If you’re a Zelda fan, or like Platforms make sure to give this oldie but goodie hack a try. :)

game.name: 210 - Megaman (U) [!]
game.info: This is Dragonsbrethren’s lame first hack.

game.name: 2107 - Aladdin 4 (1996) (Unl) [!]
game.info: This is a hack for Aladdin 4 which replaces the soundtrack with one that better resembles the original SNES music.

game.name: 2114 - Pro Wrestling (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: This patches converts Pro Wrestling for the NES into Impact Wrestling! Now you can wrestle in the TNA Impact Zone in all of it’s 8-bit glory! Choose from six different TNA wrestlers and work your way up the ranks to become World Champion! A special thank goes out to Captain N and Triverse for giving me the inspiration to make this hack. Enjoy!!!

game.name: 2116 - Rockman 4 - Aratanaru Yabou!! (J) [!]
game.info: Rockman 4 - Burst Chaser X Air Sliding is a romhack that combines two unique concepts from 2 different Rockman hacks. Burst Chaser, where Rockman moves fast with farther jumping distance. And Air Sliding, where Rockman can slide in mid-air.

game.name: 2117 - Tecmo Super Bowl (U) [!]
game.info: Features:

game.name: 212 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: I left this hack in the back burner in 2005 when I first released a demo. I was poking at it back and forth in 2006 but didn’t have the motivation to work and the hack and almost killed it.

game.name: 2126 - Earthbound Zero by Demiforce v1.01-1 (Hack)
game.info: This is yet another mature hack for EB0. Less mature than Red Rocket. But the reason this came to be was weed.

game.name: 2136 - Legend of Zelda, The (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: Various ancient legends have been recorded of a young boy clothed in green, wielding the mythical master sword, sealing away all evil throughout the land. His ventures, passed down through generations have become legend. The hero of legend, had many different forms. He saved many kingdoms, restoring peace in all the lands. This is but one of the legends, of which the people speak…

game.name: 214 - Battle City (J) [!]
game.info: I’ve been working on this for a couple of days, destroy tanks and protect what’s yours in all new levels. Working on this hack was a great change of pace, I’m glad to have worked on this hack. Enjoy the hack everyone, please the readme for more info. 8D

game.name: 2152 - Felix the Cat (U) [!]
game.info: Basically - small patch which eliminates STA $2001 = 11100000 making picture bright and colorful as it should be. My guess is that originally dimmed down picture were intended to make kids’ eyes less tired from playing and in my opinion - but sadly results made it go to other extreme - dimmed down picture looks boring.

game.name: 2156 - Batman (U) [!]
game.info: This hack changes the blue color scheme of Batman to grey in order to be more faithful to the original film.

game.name: 2158 - Excitebike (Japan, USA)
game.info: Play Excitebike as a Skeleton this Halloween!

game.name: 2159 - Magical Kid's Doropie (Japan)
game.info: This is a hack of a game that essential was a virtual copy of the gameplay of the classic Mega Man series. The player now controls Mega Man instead of the little witch girl.

game.name: 216 - Megaman (U) [!]
game.info: In the creator’s words:

game.info: Recreation of Ms. Pac Man Plus. All 32 levels are edited and follow the original game’s maze pattern. Also, levels 17, 21, 25, and 30-32 are the author’s own creations from a previously failed planned hack. Patch to a USA ROM file. Enjoy folks!

game.name: 2166 - Super Mario Bros. 2 (USA)
game.info: A hack of Mario 2 where the characters have been redrawn to resemble Carnage, Demo Goblin, Doppelganger, and Shriek. With this hack, a new story of Maximum Carnage will unfold.

game.name: 2167 - Bugs Bunny Crazy Castle, The (USA)
game.info: This hack consists of updated graphics and color changes. The result is a brighter and more colorful game. Each Looney Tune character appears closer to their classic animated counterparts. Along with the graphics update, this hack also includes 64 new levels to explore. Separate patches are available for the updated graphics and level edit.

game.name: 2168 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: A Halloween themed hack of Super Mario Bros.

game.name: 2169 - Super Mario Bros. 2 (USA)
game.info: A Super Mario Bros. 2 hack that changes the graphics into the world of the TransFormers.

game.name: 217 - Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]
game.description: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]
game.info: This is my second Zelda II hack, and just like the first, it is a whole new adventure!

game.info: Kung Fu edited to resemble Atari style graphics.

game.name: 2172 - Ice Climber (USA, Europe, Korea)
game.info: Players control rock creatures in this Ice Climber hack.

game.name: 2173 - Mega Man 3 (USA)
game.info: The purpose of this hack was to make the original Mega Man III much easier for gamers that find games that aren’t too incredibly tough more enjoyable.

game.name: 2179 - Krion Conquest, The (U) [!]
game.info: Hidden Feature “CONTINUE” in The Krion Conquest US ver. Like Japanese version of Magical Doropie.

game.name: 2182 - Bugs Bunny Crazy Castle, The (USA)
game.info: This is a complete hack of the Bugs Bunny Crazy Castle where the characters have been replaced with Mario characters and items. Many graphics were taken from SMB, SMB2, and SMB3.

game.name: 2190 - Castlevania (USA) (Rev A)
game.info: The purpose of this hack was to make the original Castlevania a little more challenging for gamers that have already beaten the original and crave a new, yet familiar challenge. The game is not meant to be impossible, just a bit harder than the original.

game.name: 2192 - Legend of Zelda, The (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: Shin Zelda Densetsu is a complete overwrite of The Legend of Zelda, made by Lord Steak over 10 years ago. In a novel twist, the player must guide Princess Zelda on a quest to rescue Link from the forces of evil.

game.name: 2196 - Megaman IV (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: This Hack of Mega Man 4/Rockman 4, Francesca (known as Doropie in Japanese name)

game.name: 2197 - Super Mario Bros. 2 (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: Evil Clowns are escaping the circus and are spreading their wickedness throughout the land.

game.name: 220 - Battle City (J) [!]
game.info: This hack makes Battle City more realistic and greatly improves the graphics. The realism comes from these graphics and how they’re used, some maps have small villages surrounded by rivers and forests, others take place in completely urban environments. Some maps don’t have any buildings at all, which is a hindrance since you can’t use them for cover. As you can see in the screenshots, it also translates the game into Russian.

game.name: 2205 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: This is a level mod that makes the original Super Mario Bros easier. Nearly all bottomless pits have been eliminated and that are far more power-ups scattered throughout all the levels.

game.name: 2206 - Super Mario Bros. 2 (USA)
game.info: A palette & music hack of Mario 2 in order to make the game a bit more creepier than it originally was.

game.name: 2210 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: This is a Mario hack that makes the original game a bit more challenging, but no where near as insane as other difficulty hacks that a nearly impossible. Power-ups are scarce and Mario & Luigi’s palletes have been updated.

game.name: 2211 - Earthbound (U) (Prototype)
game.info: Mother: 25th Anniversary Edition aims to make Mother much more enjoyable for both Earthbound fans and those playing it for the first time.

game.name: 2213 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: Jimbo is a wacky tropical dude exploring the islands of Gitchi Goonie for his paycheck. This hack is a complete level hack of the original Super Mario Bros with some updated graphics. A few gameplay elements have been changed too (fireballs have a shorter bounce to make it easier to hit foes). This hack can be a bit of a challenge and the player starts with 9 lives.

game.name: 2215 - Bugs Bunny Crazy Castle, The (USA)
game.info: A hack of Crazy Castle with a Castlevania theme. Guide Simon Belmont through the hidden crypts of Dracula’s castle after defeating the famous count. The last remaining skeletons and other creatures are lurking about seeking revenge for the destruction of their master.

game.name: 2219 - Mega Man 4 (USA) (Rev A)
game.info: The purpose of this hack was to make the original Mega Man IV much easier for gamers that find games that aren’t too incredibly tough more enjoyable.

game.name: 2221 - Gimmick! (J) [!]
game.info: This is a hack one of the greatest and most unappreciated game for Famicom.

game.name: 2229 - Startropics (U) [!]
game.info: Two of the music tracks in StarTropics are slightly broken, the island map music, and one of the ending tunes. This patch fixes them both.

game.name: 2237 - Shadow Warriors - Ninja Gaiden (Europe)
game.info: No major change in gameplay but:

game.name: 2243 - Megaman III (U) [!]
game.info: Patch Switch Weapon for Mega Man III. Featuring Switch Weapon Like Rockman 3 Complete Works for PSX or Anniversary Collection version of Mega Man III. Works 5 versions of NES, PAL, RM3 JP, PlayChoice-10, US Prototype.

game.name: 2250 - Ms. Pac-Man (USA) (Namco)
game.info: This has to be my best Ms. Pac-Man hack yet, or is it? This hack features outlandish mazes, wacky colors and crazy patterns. 7 out of the 8 maze types are from my custom maze collection. Try this hack out for yourself. ROM is a USA. Have fun!

game.name: 2251 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: The true final installment to this series? You can say that, but not without the E1S touch. Something very unique is done for this truly last installment to the NEW series. This hack is complete with new graphics, some from the games, and some are original. Test your way through another set of new levels, repeated stages, default SMB3 level with slight modifications, and the map screens resemble the 1 path aspect of the modern Mario games. Enjoy folks!

game.name: 2256 - Megaman V (U) [!]
game.info: This Hack of MM5, Changed all levels and add enemies, Now Difficulty is HARD MODE. Advanced Edition of MM5, it’s based on original version of all levels. Please into Mega Man 5 US ROM not Rockman 5 JP ROM.

game.name: 226 - STED - Iseki Wakusei no Yabou (J) [!]
game.info: This hack will add an experience counter to each characters’ Data window.

game.name: 2269 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: There are many hacks for the first NES Final Fantasy. Some consider two of them to be the definitive versions of the game. The first is AstralEsper’s Final Fantasy Restored. The next is Grond’s Final Fantasy. The font used, however, is difficult to look at to many. To give people the choice as to which font they’d prefer, this font package was made.

game.name: 227 - Faxanadu (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: Well, I wanted to keep this game as close to the original as possible. So no palette changes, no credit modification, just tiles that were modified in the U.S. release are restored.

game.name: 2272 - Ms. Pac-Man (USA) (Namco)
game.info: A miniature version of the game. This hack is in reference to the Tengen version of Ms. Pac-Man. It even goes in Tengen order. That’s right, all 32 levels do not repeat exactly like the arcade, but goes in its own order. It has never been possible to see a Ms. Pac-Man NES Namco game do that, until now.

game.name: 2273 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: Jump across many pits filled with lava, water, or nothing at all. Run within an underground cavern as you battle turtles and creepy monsters or walk above the skies. Soil Bowser’s plans as you save 7 Toads and the Princess once again. Relive the memories of Mario and Luigi’s first adventure in this new game; a rom edit of the classic Super Mario Bros.

game.name: 2289 - Adventures of Lolo (U) [!]
game.info: This is a level hack of the original Lolo that edits the first 30 levels, as well as palettes, some graphics, text, and remixes the music.

game.name: 2293 - Rockman 3 - Dr. Wily no Saigo! (J) [!]
game.info: This Hack, Japanese version of Mega Man 3 called Rockman 3 Showdown Edition. Featuring Boss Rush Mode with 8 Robot Masters and except Four Doc Robot’s Stages.

game.name: 2294 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: Rockman 2 Endless is a romp through classic Megaman 2 using the same “endless” mode established in Megaman 9 and continued in Megaman 10. The game is an endurance mode that challenges the player to see how long they can survive in a Megaman game given only one life and no energy tanks. Guide Megaman through over 40 random areas in a never ending assault on Wily’s robots. Every thirty screens you clear presents you with a random boss ranging from Airman or Flashman to even the good Dr. himself. You’ll start off armed with every weapon in the game, so go out there and trash some metal!

game.name: 2300 - Rockman 5 - Blues no Wana! (J) [!]
game.info: Rockman: Install Metal is an extensive Rockman 5 (NOT Megaman V) level hack.

game.name: 2312 - Prince of Persia (U) [!]
game.info: This hack changes levels’ palette, making them more similar to the MS-DOS version of the game. Every 2-3 levels colors change as in version 1.3 for MS-DOS (green dungeon at level 3, instead of blue as in levels 1-2). See screenshots for more information.

game.name: 2322 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This hack gives you the ability to play through the entire world of Super Mario Bros. as Princess Peach with her floating powers from Super Mario Bros. 2!

game.name: 2329 - Silver Surfer (U) [!]
game.info: This patch allows you to fire constantly by holding the fire button down rather than having to press it each time you want to fire. Useful if you don’t have a turbo controller.

game.name: 2335 - Friday the 13th (USA)
game.info: This hack changes the color palettes of Jason to make him look more accurate to his movie counterpart.

game.name: 2341 - Castlevania II - Simon's Quest (U) [!]
game.info: This hack is left almost untouched the world of the game, but added many new things, such as dialogs, new quests, difficulty and other. You need to think in order to complete the game. If you have something to say or ask any questions, please write to lomax123@yandex.ru

game.name: 2350 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a full ROM hack for Rockman 2 which changes all the level graphics, music for all the stages, new dialogue, and also some alterations to enemy behavior.

game.name: 2359 - Megaman II (U) [!]
game.info: Quite simply, Mega Man II Optimum is an upgraded version of the Megaman 2 ROM. It converts the ROM’s mapper to MMC5, and its graphics format to CHR-ROM. That’s it!

game.name: 236 - Super Mario Bros. 2 (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: Just a small modification. It takes the underground/cave music from the Super Mario Brothers 2 prototype and puts it in the final version.

game.name: 2360 - Castlevania (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: A patch that converts the mapper of Castlevania to MMC5.

game.name: 2365 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: This is a hack of Super Mario Bros. with some minor graphical and gameplay changes to make the game more interesting. A couple level changes had to be made in 8-1 and 8-4 to make the game finishable, but apart from that, the levels were left intact.

game.name: 2376 - Super Glove Ball (U) [!]
game.info: This patch adds support for the Japanese Famicom version of the Power Glove, the PAX Power Glove.

game.name: 2377 - Gradius (U) [!]
game.info: Here is a graphics hack for Gradius which changes the level landscapes and sprites.

game.name: 2379 - Battle City (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a hack for Battle City which changes all the levels in the game.

game.name: 2390 - Megaman III (U) [!]

Skullbot 1101X, a.k.a. Skullby, is a skeleton robot who can cut shit up! Then Tedriss, a giant Tedi from Conker’s Bad Fur Day wants to rip your head off! Voltang, an electrical unit bot, is a high powered robot capable of fucking you up. Meanie, a mean guy is ice-cold, oooooooooooo. Sam Sinister, a tricky kniving bastard of his own self. Last but not least, Hot Hitt, a demon from Hell, who wants to send you there for eternal damnation, damn it.

game.name: 2608 - Magic Dragon (Unl)
game.info: R-Type is a game that set the standards for side scrolling shooters. It had a unique force weapon that could attach and detach from your ship, serve as a second blaster on the screen, and could also be used as a shield to protect your ship from oncoming attacks. It also had intense alien boss battles where your ship would take on an enemies the size of the screen. This awesome game had ports made for several different consoles, but somehow never made its way over to the NES. What we got instead is a Japanese clone called Magic Dragon. Although Magic Dragon is a blatant ripoff of R-Type, the graphics were horrible in comparison. The ship was an ugly yellow, and the enemies were nothing more than genetic robots. This hack changes all of that, and turns Magic Dragon into the game it was trying to copy, R-Type. The R-9 ship was added back in place of the awful yellow one. All graphics, enemies, and bosses were changed as well.

The graphics are changed a little, but the levels themselves present twenty all-new challenges! The first quest shouldn’t be too too difficult, but the second quest was made specially different from the normal mode for an extra hair-pulling challenge!

game.name: 2983 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]

game.name: 2984 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Frank’s first “ultimate” Super Mario Bros. hack. It’s pretty good, really, but absolutely pales in comparison to the third one. Still, if you liked that one, and are looking for more of the same, this is a pretty good bet. It has 28 levels instead of 20, essentially meaning the levels are stretched out thinner. Which means, overall, they’re not quite as interesting.

game.name: 2991 - Castlevania (Europe)

game.name: 300 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG0) [!]

Levels don’t start out terribly difficult, but get tricky later on, though they never become unfair. Secrets are strewn throughout the many levels, including new levels for the White Mushroom Houses, with new coin requirements, and the hidden whistle.

This way you don’t have to open the Inventar every time you want to heal and it prevents the Inventar from getting spammed with low healing items.

game.name: 3032 - Megaman III (U) [!]
game.info: It is a known fact that the original release of Mega Man III on the NES was largely incomplete. Between 2012 and 2015, a rom hacker by the name of “Kuja Killer” released an updated version of Mega Man 3 that fixed many bugs, reduced lag and added several new features but left all the level design intact.

game.name: 304 - Hoshi wo Miru Hito (J) [!]
game.info: This is a patch for Hoshi wo Miruhito (meaning Stargazers), an RPG for the NES.

game.name: 3040 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (USA)
game.info: This is a hack dedicated to the great Mario player and streamer Grand_POOBear. It follows in the same veins as Obitus 1’s “Kaizo Mario Bros. 3″ and Mitch Fowler’s “The Final Kaizo” in that it is a mostly levels-hack involving incredible tricks and excruciatingly difficult gameplay. However, while it IS no doubtedly intense, Super POO Bros. 3 is a bit less hardcore than its inspirations in some places.

game.name: 3049 - Magical Doropie (J)
game.info: Before you - an improved hack the game Magical Doropie, based on “Magical Rockman” title: http://www.romhacking.net/hacks/2159/ Compared to the aforementioned hack, this hack has been improved all that was required to be finalized. Here is the list of changes:

game.name: 305 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: Rockman Exhaust has custom levels and including music. It’s a great gameplay. Requires Rockman 2 ROM. Not Megaman 2. Keep that in mind.

game.name: 3055 - Sou Setsu Ryuu II - The Revenge (Japan)
game.description: Sou Setsu Ryuu II - The Revenge (Japan)
game.info: Here is a hack which replaces the normal enemies with the bosses making the game more challenging to progress though.

game.name: 3058 - Donkey Kong (World) (Rev A)
game.info: Fellow rom hack enthusiasts, we present to you… Unparalleled action. Choice scoops of ice cream. King size ice cream cones.

game.name: 306 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: The objective of this 6-level hack is to beat the levels before the 99 seconds run out. Please read the readme in the zip file for more information.

game.name: 3060 - Super Pitfall (U) [!]
game.info: Super Pitfall 30th Anniversary Edition. Release 1.0 - 05 Sept 2016. A hack by Nesrocks. New soundtrack by FCandChill. Pitfall II arrangements by rockman_x_2002.

game.name: 3067 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: Final Fantasy Ultra just got better! The philosophy is still to add and change as much as possible for the better, while still staying true to the spirit of the game.

game.name: 3068 - Galaxy 5000 - Racing in the 51st Century (USA)
game.info: If you finish all tracks on the first planet (Mercury) in 2P mode “The End” screen shows up. This hack removes this limitation, now you can race on all tracks on all 9 planets except the final track. Every track has 100 seconds of extra time and 9 continues. It was done because of high difficulty of the game.

game.name: 307 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: Super Loco Spoof! 2 is the sequel to the Super Mario Bros. hack called Super Loco Spoof!. This hack was given to Googie by Rockman (AKA RetroRain) in case he wanted to finish it. This is the hack that got him motivated to ROM Hack again. Please read the readme for more information in the zip file.

game.name: 3071 - Penguin & Seal, The (Sachen-HES) [!]
game.info: This is an improvement hack of unlicensed Sachen/Thin Chen Enterprises Corporation puzzle game called “The Penguin & Seal”. Here is a list of changes:

game.name: 3073 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Rohrleitung Gate is a Steins;Gate inspired SMB1 hack. Unlike most other SMB1 hacks, it’s a puzzle solving game, and requires quite some understanding to the SMB mechanics to beat. Savestates are recommended for this hack.

game.name: 308 - Pescatore (J) (Prototype) [!]
game.info: This patch fixes a memory-usage conflict in the original game.

game.name: 3082 - Super C (USA)
game.info: The original final boss of this great game was really too easy. This is now corrected.

game.name: 3087 - Ms. Pac-Man (USA) (Namco)
game.info: Pac-Man Xtreme is a ROMhack of the Namco version of Ms. Pac-Man for the Nintendo NES. Officially released by KaBooM! on September 17 2016, it is much more than a simple maze/level hack. Pac-Man Xtreme introduces new features, functions, and selectable options which make playing it a truly unique experience. Almost every single aspect of the original Ms. Pac-Man game has been altered… graphics, sounds and music, levels, even gameplay mechanics. In essence, Pac-Man Xtreme is a new commercial-quality game reprogrammed around Ms. Pac-Man’s engine and is thus virtually unrecognizable from its predecessor.

game.name: 3090 - BB Car (Unl) [!]
game.info: Before you - hack of unusual pirate game called “BB Car”. This unlicensed port of “Rally-X” has undergone major changes. Now it’s a race on motorboats.

game.name: 3099 - Tom & Jerry (U) [!]
game.info: In order to complete a level you must collect all the cheese it has, big and small.

game.name: 3100 - Nintendo World Cup (USA)
game.info: Now with 66.7% more pompadors! …depending on what hair fits the definition.

game.name: 3104 - Rockman 3 - Dr. Wily no Saigo! (J) [!]
game.info: Rockman 3: Zone of Eden is a romhack of Rockman 3 (NOT Mega Man III). The romhack modified the following:

game.name: 3105 - Rockman 3 - Dr. Wily no Saigo! (J) [!]

game.name: 3123 - Kunio 8-in-1 [p1]
game.info: This is the main tournament rom for NEKKETSU SPORTS TOURNAMENTS community. These games are hacks of original roms. We update our multicart every 3-6 months. Most games with russian translation. You can contact me and our group for more information.

game.name: 3125 - Mega Man 6 (USA)
game.info: Designed to be a somewhat harder extra game or “next loop” for Mega Man 6, this hack features new level layouts, different boss weaknesses and arenas, faster screen loads & menus, and a brand new, unarguably different plot from the original game.

game.name: 3127 - Castlevania (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: Hack of Castlevania where Sonia Belmont from the Gameboy title “Castlevania: Legends” is now the playable character instead of Simon.

game.name: 3134 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: What you have here: The old Metroid Deluxe map and layout with a few bugs worked out and snarfblam’s Metroid Plus hacks added, (Namely, save games, maps, and the ice beam / wave beam combo).

game.name: 3149 - Metal Force (K) [!]
game.info: Here is a hack of the game a little-known Korean firm “Open Corporation”.

game.name: 315 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This hack is my very first hack I’ve ever even attempted, and it turned out better than I thought. Although the graphics haven’t changed, the sound is also the same as the original SMB, and all that, the levels have been re-done.

game.name: 3157 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: Kamikaze Bros. 3 is a kaizo style SMB3 romhack.

game.name: 3159 - Pinball (JU) [!]
game.info: This hack edits the graphics and colors of the game, leaving it with a more beautiful look.

game.name: 3160 - Swamp Thing (U) [!]
game.info: This hack modifies the graphics of the Swamp Thing into Bart Simpson as well as the graphics of the enemies were also changed to ones of The Simpsons. Dialogue & text have also been redone to give it a pseudo sequel continuation of the game The Simpsons - Bart Vs. the Space Mutants.

game.name: 3162 - Adventure Island (U) [!]
game.info: This hack edits the graphics and colors of the game (sprites and scenery), leaving you with a more beautiful look.

game.name: 3165 - Kero Kero Keroppi no Daibouken 2 - Donuts Ike wa Oosawagi! (Japan)
game.description: Kero Kero Keroppi no Daibouken 2 - Donuts Ike wa Oosawagi! (Japan)
game.info: This hack modifies the graphics of the character of Kero Kero Keroppi no Daibouken 2: Donuts Ike ha Oosawagi! in giving rise to the now famous character created by Czech Macbee. The scenarios and game colors were also modified, as well as the dialogue & text.

patch.name: Kero Kero Keroppi no Daibouken 2 - Donuts Ike wa Oosawagi! (Japan).ips

rom.name: Kero Kero Keroppi no Daibouken 2 - Donuts Ike wa Oosawagi! (Japan).nes

game.name: 3170 - Legend of Zelda, The (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: CXS Legend of Zelda - Hyrule’s Doom takes place 2 Years after the events of Zelda II..Link had a dream that didn’t seem right and Ganon has returned, because his Molblins took some of Link’s blood and sprinkled it on Ganon’s Ashes. This hack is hard and you’ll have a hard time finding the power bracelet and blue ring….The whole Overworld has been changed the dungeons are stuffed with more enemies..and if you want to know the full story of what’s happening read the txt file, because the story is very long… Link’s sprite, all item sprites and, the NPC’S sprites have been modified. The text has been changed in the game. Also if you look at Link Closely his hair and hat moves when he runs….Just a little something cool that got added….

game.name: 3177 - Batman - The Video Game (USA)
game.info: The ROM hack replaces Batman with Ezio from Assassin’s Creed as the playable character. Life bar, weapons and pick up icons tweaked to be more in keeping with AC.
