game.info: Here is a little improvement for this infamous game.

game.name: 319 - Hello Kitty World (J)
game.info: An unofficial “translation” of hello kitty world that replaces all the text in the game with an English “translation” that may or may not be accurate, but does fit the context.

game.name: 3190 - Mickey Mousecapade (USA)
game.info: Dr Doofenshmirtz is at it again! He’s kidnapped candace and is holding her for ransom. Play as Phineas, Ferb, Isabella, Buford, Pinky the Chihuahua and Perry the Platypus on your quest to rescue her in this all new Mickey Mousecapade rom hack.

game.name: 3191 - Donald Land (J) [!]
game.info: What Felix The Cat doing in Dolald Land?.. It’s very simple. He was invited to perform at the next anniversary of McDonald’s. But the show was thwarted. An evil wizard stole all the friends of Donald, and at his request, Felix went to the castle of the evil wizard to teach him a lesson. In his possession, a bunch of exploding apples, which he can blow up enemies in its path. And… he is Felix the Cat, and that says it all! Changes:

game.name: 3198 - Mega Man 3 (USA)
game.info: Link Man is a hack of Mega Man 3 that was inspired by the classic series, Legend of Zelda. Changes include: graphics have been changed to elements of the series, a new story, levels with some redesign, and weapon energy consumption. This hack includes a full colored manual inspired by those found in the NES era.

game.name: 3201 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: This is a hack of Super Mario Bros imagining what happens to Mario’s ghost every time he loses a life. Levels have been created to be very difficult and all of the graphics and palettes fit a dark, gruesome theme.

game.name: 3202 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: This is a hack of Super Mario Bros with all of the graphics redrawn to simulate an even tinier version of Mario.

game.name: 321 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (Japan)
game.info: Rockman No Constancy is a complete romhack of Rockman 2.

game.name: 3213 - Super Mario World (Unl)
game.info: This is a small patch which fixes a few issues with the Super Mario World NES ROM. First, it fixes the running speed. It greatly reduces it, making running into enemies less likely. The second thing it does is make jumping speed faster so you can more easily jump over pits and obstacles.

game.name: 3218 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (USA) (Rev A)
game.info: With 8 newly themed worlds to explore, Super Mario Bros 3: A New Journey sticks with the original SMB3 format while using new graphics, custom over-world music and new levels to continue Mario and Luigi’s adventure beyond the original 8 worlds. Some tweaked sprites are also present. The difficulty is meant for semi-experienced players looking for new challenges.

game.name: 3227 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This hack edits the graphics and colors of the game, leaving you with a more beautiful and modern look. The sprites of the characters Mario and Luigi of this game have been replaced by the sprites of the game Super Mario Bros. 3.

game.name: 3228 - Rockin' Kats (U) [!]
game.info: This hack edits the graphics of the main character of the game Rockin ‘Kats, giving way to the already famous Czech character, created by Macbee. The texts of the game have also been modified and are in Portuguese.

game.name: 3231 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: Rockman CX Ver 1.1

game.name: 3237 - Makaimura AC Title R (Hack)
game.info: Before you - a facilitating hack of the most pitiless game on Famicom.”Makaimura Arcade Conversion - Fair Play” (original hack made by 2CH) have a row of changes, notedly facilitating passing of the game:

game.name: 324 - Double Dragon (U) [!]
game.info: This is a hack which replaces the main character Billy with his brother Jimmy in the main game and in versus mode. Jimmy must save his brother from the end boss rather than the usual Marian rescue. Jeff, the green palette swap of billy from the arcade game, is the end boss and also the opponent of Jimmy in versus mode.

game.name: 3241 - Megaman III (U) [!]
game.info: Megaman 3 Prometeo Jriva 2016

game.name: 3242 - Ultimate Stuntman (Camerica) [!]
game.info: Here is a improvement hack one of the most famous NES games from Codemasters - The Ultimate Stuntman. List of changes:

game.name: 3250 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: Here is a hack just in time for the holidays where you fight a Christmas themed Woodman! This is the only level and boss that you will fight in this hack and also Mega Man wears a Santa cap!

game.name: 3266 - Kirby's Adventure (USA)
game.info: This hack only includes one level made up of all the Vegetable Valley levels with minor modifications and no collectable 1-Ups. (The 1-Ups are replaced with Tomatoes). The UFO secret was also removed.

game.name: 3267 - Pachi Com (J) [!]
game.info: This hack Pachi Com game. If the game screen is one ball, then the collision is divided into five balls.

game.name: 3269 - Championship Bowling (U) [!]
game.info: This patch converts Championship Bowling to MMC3 mapper.

game.name: 3270 - American Gladiators (U) [!]
game.info: This patch converts American Gladiators to MMC3 mapper.

game.name: 3273 - Dragon's Lair (E) [!]
game.info: This hack is dated 33 th anniversary of the video game of the same name, as well as the upcoming premiere of the full-length animated film Don Bluth. Now you are finally able to go to your favorite game on your favorite console without the torment that you experienced while playing the original game. List of changes:

game.name: 3274 - Snow Bros. (U) [!]
game.info: So, here we go! Winter game for winter season. Legendary Snow Brothers is back in a new adventure, full of new thrills. Note: This hack is not a sequel to the original game. List of changes:

game.name: 3276 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (USA) (Rev A)
game.info: A very colorful and different take on Super Mario Bros 3. Seven worlds. At least 95 levels. Can you make it to the end and save the princess?

game.name: 3277 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (USA) (Rev A)
game.info: The Sequel to “Super Mario Bros 3.75 Torva Edition”. The game contains eight worlds each of them complete with distinguishable graphics and at least 125 accessible levels. (100 of those are accessible from the world map alone) Return of the Den Mother’s Mushroom and a new bonus: Mike’s Room. Can you save the princess?

game.name: 3279 - Super Mario Bros. 2 (USA)
game.info: The majority of the character and backdrop graphics have been changed to fit a Halloween theme.

game.name: 3280 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: (Updated to Version 1.21 - See “readme” for change log)

game.name: 3281 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: This started off as a palette restoration of Messatu’s X1 hack. It is a combination of Messatu’s enjoyable new minor features and lovely title screen, but with how Levi “Karatorian” Aho and frantik’s hack actually looked like a NES game. Once the palettes and flash effect cycles were restored to that of their version, sprites were then also restored and a few small tweaks made.

game.name: 3285 - Mega Man 3 (USA)
game.info: This is a graphical hack of Mega Man III where all of the graphics have been changed to resemble graphics found in an Atari game.

game.name: 3286 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: The graphics have been changed to rememble those found on an Atari game.

game.name: 3287 - Bugs Bunny Crazy Castle, The (USA)
game.info: This is a hack of Bugs Bunny Crazy Castle where the graphics have been changed to resemble graphics found on the Atari 2600. Also included is a patch with 64 all new levels. The graphics and levels were created in separate patch files so that they may be compatible with other hacks. For example, the graphics patch may be applied to other level hacks where the graphics were left unchanged.

game.name: 3292 - Arkista's Ring (USA)
game.info: EDGIE EDDIE WANTS TO BEAT ALL THE CLOVERMON. It’s right there on the status screen. Shoot your way through 31 levels of toxic raptors, burning pumpkins, screaming penguins and various other monstrosities - and then do it all over again another three times! Good luck with level 30! :^)

game.name: 3293 - Karate Champ (USA)
game.info: Karate Champed is a hack of Karate Champ.

game.name: 3294 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: This is a hack of Super Mario Bros. but is a Spoof of All Night Nippon and includes two patches. It was made entirely in Windows XP thus the name Xtra Promo came to be. It is hard to explain this hack in a few words you should refer to the long readme for more elaborate details.

game.name: 3298 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Dream Mario Bros. is a graphics hack of Super Mario Bros. created by The Super Show in 2017. After a series of failed attempts and tales of woe, our hero decided to make a fresh looking SMB hack using nothing but a broken pencil, an lukewarm cup of coffee, and a lots of classic rock. After much backbreaking work, The Super Show released his hack to the public, after figuring out what exactly an author URL was. The Super Show wanted to give personal thanks to all those amazing Romhackers out there that have kept him amused for many a year. So, here it is, Dream Mario Bros.

game.name: 33 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Now that Ghosts have invaded the Mushroom Kingdom and Mario is gone, Luigi in on an adventure to save the Mushroom Kingdom from his greatest fear. He’ll also encounter zombies, Panser plants and the Phantom who makes Luigi’s life miserable. You’ll also find that this hack has two endings, one good and one real. And the music has a sad creepy tone to it. So if your craving for a challenge, help Luigi end this nightmare…

game.name: 3302 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: This hack is an addendum to the Rockman Exhaust hack. The original hack by DHI is overall very fun, but unfortunately, it has several issues that are more or less game breaking. This hack attempts to fix these issues in order to make the game more enjoyable.

game.name: 3307 - StarTropics (USA)
game.info: This patch removes the 8 frame delay after changing directions and reduces it to 1 frame. You can still change direction without moving by a quick tap of the direction pad.

game.name: 3316 - King's Quest V (USA)
game.info: A simple hack of King’s Quest V that changes the font to something a little more reminiscent of one of Sierra’s PC titles.

game.name: 3332 - Super Mario Bros. 2 (USA)
game.info: This is a patch for the USA version of Super Mario Bros. 2, to make the game more like the other Mario games. For instance, the cherries have been replaced with coins, and collecting 100 of them will give you an extra life. The turtle shells reverse direction when colliding with a wall, rather than disappearing. The readme contains all of the changes that have been made to this game.

game.name: 3338 - Marble Madness (USA)
game.info: Is a multifaceted hack of Marble Madness, as in there are two different versions, on is a normal hack and the second makes the game Black and White “Grey-scale” both are similarly themed though were hacked in different fashions. There are 5 patches in the archive easy and normal hard versions of both hacks, and there is included a patch for Marble Madness that is just a easy version.

game.name: 3347 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of Super Mario Bros. that is meant to give Luigi the leading role with remixed levels from Super Mario Bros. 2 (Japan) and Super Mario Bros. Special. It also comes with remixed Graphics and a new power-up!

game.name: 3355 - Metal Gear (U) [!]
game.info: This hack gives Snake his iconic sneaking suit, using redrawn sprites based on the style of Ghost Babel. Since the Ghost Babel look (with its darker hues and frequent lack of outlines) resulted in Snake blending with the original game’s rather busy, rather dark backgrounds, these have been redrawn or touched up, thus giving the visuals a cleaner, brighter appearance, while also staying true to the spirit of the original game.

game.name: 3382 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: Rockman 2: Basic Master is a complete level hack of Rockman 2 for the NES. New music, new (and old) enemies, different boss behaviors, and more.

game.name: 3386 - Kart Fighter (Unl)
game.info: This is a hack of the bootleg game Kart Fighter developed by Hummer Team in 1993/1994. The hack changes all the Japanese names of characters into the North American versions. It also changes the title screen to say “SMASH BROS.” without “SUPER” to imply that this came before Super Smash Bros. on the Nintendo 64. If someone wants to make a Kart Fighter hack to make it look like Super Smash Bros. even more than the publisher of this hack did (such as fixing the sprites), it would be a good idea to use this patch as a starting point. Use Lunar IPS for patching.

game.name: 3388 - Monster in My Pocket (U) [!]
game.info: This hack is based on the Mexican film of 1969 “el santo y blue demon contra los monstruos.” Made in Mexico.

game.name: 34 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: While Mario is romping through the Mushroom Kingdom’s royal water fountains one day, he is witness to a mysterious phenomenon: the fish from around the kingdom begin to take flight! It’s up to the Mario Brothers to find out what is responsible (I wonder…) and stop it before the local fish markets are all dried up! Note that this is a “mini-hack” – a novelty/concept hack that is complete and spawns only one world.

game.name: 3413 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: This hack changes big Mario into Weird Mario from Super Mario Maker,

game.name: 3420 - Choujikuu Yousai - Macross (Japan)
game.info: Air Fortress 2 is a hack of Macross. There is an alternate patch, the fourth image shows what is different.

game.name: 3421 - Choujikuu Yousai - Macross (Japan)
game.info: Trans Formers Z is a hack of Macross, includes a lesser hack called Formation Z Macross that is mostly what inspired the hack, but didn’t care for it as much.

game.name: 3422 - Choujikuu Yousai - Macross (Japan)
game.info: Thunder Force 3 is a Hack of Macross, this is the one hack of a series that had no original game to work from, but bought the Sega Genesis game and decide to bring it to the Nes sort of.

game.name: 3424 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: This is a remastered version of the first Final Fantasy. The main goal of the hack is to “modernize” the first game making it coincide with later entries in the series (mainly III) and just in general a more enjoyable experience. The hack better paces the game and fixes a lot of the issues the original had while keeping the difficulty level quite high. This is the definitive version of Final Fantasy and should be experienced by both fans and newcomers of the original NES classic.

game.name: 3425 - Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles II - The Arcade Game (USA)
game.description: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles II - The Arcade Game (USA)
game.info: This hack changes and fixes a bunch of stuff in this game, here’s what it does to it:

patch.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles II - The Arcade Game (USA).ips

rom.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles II - The Arcade Game (USA).nes

game.name: 3429 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (USA)
game.info: While taking a vacation from the Mushroom Kingdom, something has gone horrendously wrong for Mario and Peach! After their ship sinks in the middle of the ocean, Mario awakes on the mysterious Skull Island with Peach nowhere in sight. The Island will put Mario to the test as he fights through the Island monsters to get to the Castle on the other side and rescue Peach.

game.name: 3437 - Balloon Fight (USA)
game.info: Balloofang Fight is another spin-off game of the “wildly popular” ROM hack, Pokemon Clover. In this game, you play as Piicee (Thanks doc!) as you attempt to pop the Balloofang of wild Spookster. Team up with a friend to make it a little easier, or go it alone in Hardcore Mode! Think you can get the high score?

game.name: 3438 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: KAWA MARIO BROS 3.

game.name: 3439 - Track & Field (U) [!]

game.name: 3440 - Race America (U) [!]

game.name: 3441 - Battletoads (U) [!]
game.info: Mod/hack adds fourth (and third) player to Battletoads (NES, U-version) to make possible to play the game with four people at the same time.

game.name: 3447 - Ms. Pac-Man (USA) (Namco)
game.info: What this patch does is add extracted graphics from the game to some extra space that exist in the rom, and allows for easier Hacking of the graphics because they are extracted for you. They still have to be put into the correct places in the Rom.

game.name: 3450 - Dragon Warrior II (USA)
game.info: The purpose of this hack is to mitigate many of the flaws of Dragon Warrior II in order to create an overall play experience more similar to that of its NES sequels.

game.name: 3453 - River City Ransom (U) [!]
game.info: This is designed to fix a few things without changing the game too much. This could be a nice base for other small hacks.

game.name: 3457 - Megaman II (U) [!]
game.info: This is a complete hack to a previously unfinished version by DragonEye Studios. The abandoned version had some great ideas and lots of potential, so the purpose of this project was to refine the problematic areas and complete the hack so that the player can play all the way to the end and finish the game.

game.name: 3460 - Mike Tyson's Punch-Out!! (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: This hack changes and fixes a few things in this game, here’s what it does to it:

game.name: 3463 - Castlevania III - Dracula's Curse (U) [!]
game.info: Just a modification on Alucard sprite so it looks more like SOTN character.

game.name: 3464 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: Inspired by its kaizo counterparts, Sky Mario Bros 3. takes the charm of vanilla smb3, and combines it with an incremental kaizo difficulty!

game.name: 3466 - Megaman V (U) [!]
game.info: Mega Man V Refined aims to improve on the original game, mainly by tweaking its level-design when it was uninspired or unfair (or both).

game.name: 3468 - Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles III - The Manhattan Project (U) [!]
game.description: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles III - The Manhattan Project (U) [!]
game.info: This hack changes and fixes a few things to this game, here’s what it does to it:

game.info: This hack changes graphics to the far future of post-apocalypse, slight layouts and the title screen.

game.name: 3480 - Ice Climber (USA, Europe, Korea)
game.info: This hack let’s you play as Nana as the first player and Popo the second player.

game.name: 3484 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Oh no!! Peach has been kidnapped in the middle of the night! It is up to Mario to save the day…well night. Help Mario through the night and save Peach from the clutches of you-know who!

game.name: 3485 - Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (U) [!]
game.info: Here’s a hack that give the characters a cartoon makeover, whee!

game.name: 3486 - Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (U) [!]
game.info: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Return to New York is a rebalance and minor remaster to the original TMNT game released in 1989. Renowned for it’s difficulty, inconsistent gameplay, and a very overpowered Donatello, the old game manual reveals a story loosely based on the 1980’s cartoon “Shredder and Splintered,” in which the Shredder has a retromutagen gun that could turn Splinter back to human, but also the TMNT back to normal turtles.

game.name: 3487 - Ko Ko Eo Deu Ben Ce (K)
game.description: Ko Ko Eo Deu Ben Ce (K)
game.info: MMC3 conversion of the unlincensed, korean game Ko Ko Eo Deu Ben Ce which is also known as Buzz & Waldog in the USA.

patch.name: Ko Ko Eo Deu Ben Ce (K).ips

rom.name: Ko Ko Eo Deu Ben Ce (K).nes

game.name: 3490 - Dragon Ball - Shen Long no Nazo (J) [!]
game.description: Dragon Ball - Shen Long no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: This patch reverts the original mapper of the game to MHROM. The translation by TransBRC used the mapper 34 hacks as base.

patch.name: Dragon Ball - Shen Long no Nazo (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Dragon Ball - Shen Long no Nazo (J) [!].nes

game.name: 3498 - Guerrilla War (U) [!]
game.info: This patch converts Guerrilla War to MMC3 mapper.

game.name: 3500 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Continuing the adventure series, Luigi embarks on a new quest to save the princess. Mario takes a summer vacation to Yoshi island, leaving Luigi in charge of the rest of Mushroom Kingdom. But of course, Luigi gets the short end of the stick and is plunged into a new quest.

game.name: 3503 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This is a short hack of Super Mario Bros. for the NES.

game.name: 3527 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Dive further into the adventure series but this time take the role of the unsung hero, Toad. Mario has been kidnapped and its up to toad to save the day. Peach went to find her beloved Mario to no avail. Journey through the autumn season fighting Bowsers minions and see if you have what it takes to save the day. Can Toad face his fears? Will toad make it through this Mushroom Kingdom nightmare? Well join up with our long time pal a find out!

game.name: 3536 - Little Nemo - The Dream Master (U) [!]
game.info: This hack restores the missing cigars back to Flip and the gorilla, they were taken out of the American version because of Nintendo of America’s guidelines.

game.name: 3546 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: Super Mario Bros. 3 - The Forgotten Worlds is the unofficial direct sequel to Super Mario Bros.: The Lost Levels.

game.name: 356 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This is the true version of Strange Mario Brothers: The Lost Levels.

game.name: 3565 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Continuing deeper into the adventure series, Yoshi comes to visit the Mushroom Kingdom for the Spring, but upon his arrival, he finds it is under attack!!! Mario and Luigi are pinned down in Mushroom Village and its up to Yoshi to save the day!! Minions are everywhere and Yoshi must destroy them all to advance to Bowser’s castle! Join up with this fan favorite and show his pals he has what it take to be a hero!!! This hack is very well done and includes:

game.name: 3569 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: Super Luigi Bros. has the same plot as Super Mario Bros., except Luigi is the first player. The game has some reversed graphics and all the 8 worlds have been edited as well.

game.name: 3570 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: When you are fire mario, if you get hit you don’t become small, you revert back to big mario, like smb3.

game.name: 3574 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Another Quest?? Another chance to save the princess?? But, why does Mario feel so weird? You guessed it! It is Gameboy Mario!! This is a hack made to look like you are playing Super Mario Bros. on Gameboy! The hack has some neat coloring and some music and sound changes to give a real old school feel.

game.name: 3579 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This patch allows you to hold the fireball shooting button down to keep shooting at a normal rate without having to release the button. Also, this patch makes Mario shoot two fireballs at once.

game.name: 3587 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This patch makes the improvement to Super Mario Bros. where the Goombas do not just fall off of edges, which making it hard to create levels with limited enemies that actual go both ways. Sick of having limited enemies to use the “both way” ability in SMB Utility? This is for you.

game.name: 3590 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This is a long lost hack that Googie sent Teeporage777 to be completed and submitted. The hack had the graphics and 2 worlds already finished and was started by ROMulus. Teeporage777 finished off the final five worlds and added some minor changes. This hack uses a mid-air jump. It will not take very long to get use to. This is a pretty tough hack but very fun at the same time. The authors of this hack hope you enjoy it. this hack was nearly doomed to time. Teeporage777 is extremely grateful to be sent this hack to work on. Please read the readme file for more info on this hack. It stars Luigi on the search for his Brother, Mario. This hack is a great adventure to all that want to enjoy a awesome SMB hack that will surely challenge them. Hacking: ROMulus, Googie, Teeporage777

game.name: 3591 - Final Mission (J) [!]
game.info: A little hack of Final Mission. Modified palette and character sprites (partially taken from Super Contra X).

game.name: 3592 - Iron Tank - The Invasion of Normandy (U) [!]
game.description: Iron Tank - The Invasion of Normandy (U) [!]
game.info: This is a hack that replaces the in-game graphics from Iron Tank (released on the NES in the US) with most of the graphics from Great Tank (released on the Famicom in Japan). It restores the swastikas and crosses that were removed from the US release, and corrects the palettes.

patch.name: Iron Tank - The Invasion of Normandy (U) [!].ips

rom.name: Iron Tank - The Invasion of Normandy (U) [!].nes

game.name: 360 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: The princess has been kidnapped by ninjas! Are you an awesome enough ninja to save her?

game.name: 3600 - Battle of Olympus, The (USA)
game.info: What this hack does:

game.name: 361 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Music hacks for Super Mario Bros I found on a Japanese site. Since nothing else is modified, they appear to be open-source and free to use.

game.name: 367 - Batman (U) [!]
game.info: This is a hack which aims to make the Batman for NES game much easier and beatable then it originally was. I found the original to be very fun, yet difficult to beat. With this hack it’s much more possible to beat the game in one set of lives.

game.name: 369 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: New maps, new graphics, new enemies, new powerups, new physics, new final boss. It’s inspired by Metroid and in fact, some tiles are imported directly from it. It’s practically a new game.

game.name: 371 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: This is the final cut to the game called “Odd Mario Bros. 3″ which can be found on many ROM sites. Ringodoggie added some pretty neat ASM changes all well as slick clever level design. People thought that this hack was lost, so now you get to play another great ROM hack. Try the hack out, you’ll be glad you did…

game.name: 377 - Adventures of Lolo 2 (U) [!]
game.info: All 50 levels are done, and a few graphics and text changes. This hack will challenge you with all new rooms while keeping the player on their toes. Thanks to everyone who was a great encouragement while I did this project. ;)

game.name: 384 - Sonic The Hedgehog (Unl) [!]
game.info: Changes starting level from Spring Yard Zone (Level 3) to Green Hill Zone (Level 1) fixes the level select screen levels and the typo

game.name: 388 - Bubble Bobble (U) [!]
game.info: BBM is a complete overhaul of original Bubble Bobble, with much, much harder stages and some neat graphics and palette changes. Note that it is possible to beat the first 15 levels without a continue, not really that hard, hehe.

game.name: 39 - Zombie Hunter (J) [!]
game.info: In the original game, you would lose the extra defence points awarded by armor, whenever you gained an experience level. This is a patch that should fix that bug. I also stopped you from gaining experience when your level is already at maximum.

game.name: 393 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Super Greyscale Brothers

game.name: 394 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: A graphics hack that is the opposite of most; instead of an improvement, it is a downgrade. The effects are pretty cool. Be sure to check out the castle level.

game.name: 402 - Binary Land (J) [o1]
game.info: This is a full graphics and palette hack that gives Binary Land a Link’s Awakening feel. This was made for Zelda fans, Link and Marin have to help each other to get out of the desert.

game.name: 410 - Battle City (J) [!]
game.info: This hack changes Battle City into a vertical-scrolling shooter.

game.name: 411 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This hack changes game Super Mario Bros into a Xmas Adventures! Mario rescues Christmas! P.S. Language - Russian

game.name: 412 - Captain Tsubasa II - Super Striker (Japan)
game.info: Captain Tsubasa 2 - Super Dream Team

game.name: 417 - Megaman IV (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: This is a redone version of Mega Man 4. All levels have been re-designed

game.name: 423 - Holy Diver (Japan)
game.info: This hack changes the game to use the Nintendo MMC-1 mapper instead of the unique Irem mapper. This is primarily useful for building reproduction cartridges or playing on an emulator that doesn’t support the original mapper.

game.name: 426 - Go! Dizzy Go! (Quattro Arcade Hack)
game.info: This is a hack for “Quattro Arcade (Unl) (U) [h1]”. This bypasses the original multi-cart selection menu automatically and patches a few things to make it run for UNROM. This makes the game look like a regular stand-alone game. Great for reproduction cartridges or an emulator that doesn’t support Camerica’s mapper.

game.name: 427 - Battle City (J) [!]
game.info: Warsaw City is a complete hack of legendary Battle City. Details in readme file. ;)

game.name: 429 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: This is a ROM hack of Rockman 2, not Mega Man II.

game.name: 433 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: Rockman Deus Ex Machina is one of the best sophisticated hacks in Mega Man II history. It is programmed almost every part of the game you’ve never expected before. The boss fights are incredibly hyperactive. Players find this hack a clear winner. Background Music is made by the author of Rockman No Constancy IKA. Additional patches were added by Misty in the Japanese 2ch boards about August 8th such as Hard Body and Weapon Modification. A must play for all expert Mega Man II players. Not newbies. Be sure you patch with the Japanese Rockman 2 ROM.

game.name: 434 - Saiyuuki World (J) [!]
game.info: This is a simple mapper hack making the game use the very common Nintendo MMC-3 mapper.

game.name: 435 - Wrecking Crew (W) [!]
game.info: This is a Wrecking Crew hack where basically all 100 Phases have been edited for new fun and challenging puzzles. Phases range from easy to hard difficulty. The letters and numbers have been edited so they are italicized, but the remaining graphics are left the same to retain the normal Wrecking Crew feel.

game.name: 437 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: This is Quick Curly’s first official attempt at ROM hacking. In this SMB3 hack, Mario and Luigi must save Princess Toadstool, who has been kidnapped by Bowser for the five hundredth time. They must travel through five different Realms before they can enter Dark Land, which may be small, but it is deadly. Changes include edited graphics, specifically the status bar. Players will advance through new levels, ranging from easy to hard difficulty. All the main text has been changed, including the Bonus Games, Toad Houses, End Castles, Princess Toadstool’s letters, and the World Name Credits. A big thank you goes out to Googie, for if it weren’t for him, this hack would never have been possible. WARNING: There may be a few mature themes, but there is no swearing.

game.name: 438 - Megaman (U) [!]
game.info: Some of you may have heard about me working on this hack for a while. And I’m proud to announce that it’s finally finished!

game.name: 439 - Bio Miracle Bokutte Upa (J) [!]
game.info: This patches the game to use the Nintendo MMC-5 chip rather than the Konami VRC-4. This is useful if you don’t have a VRC-4 for a reproduction or your emulator doesn’t support it.

game.name: 442 - Castlevania (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: My first real attempt at ROM Hacking. This is a Hell Hack for the original Castlevania. The goal was to make the game as hard as possible while attempting to be fair in game play. Vets of the series should enjoy this, but an easy version is included as well.

game.name: 446 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: Celebrating the release of Metroid Prime/Fusion, the author created Metroid Omega. Every graphic of the game is changed thanks to Jorge Fuentes’s great artistic skill, and Brinstar is transformed into an evil deathtrap. Once the author finishes a few other projects, the rest of the levels will be made just as evil as it, so have fun trying to survive!

game.name: 449 - Rockman (J) [!]
game.info: In celebration of the release of Mega Man 9 comes Rockman Kenk. What is Kenk? It’s a modified and polished version of Small Apple’s unfinished Rock Man Kai. 30% of the original patch was altered and fixed to keep the game’s feeling in line of the original game. All the levels have been redesigned and boss fights and weaknesses have been altered. Keep in mind this patch only works on the Japanese Rock Man game.

game.name: 456 - Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]
game.description: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]
game.info: This is my 3rd hack of Zelda II! This time I tried to go all out, and I think it worked. There have been countless hours put into this hack, trying to make it special, and I hope you see it when you play. :)

patch.name: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!].ips

rom.name: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!].nes

game.name: 459 - Honey Peach (Asia) (Ja) (Unl)
game.info: Due to poor engineering and programming, Sachen’s “Honey Peach” was hastily and recklessly published with a “garbled creature queen” (coined by TheRedEye) as one of the earnable softcore prizes instead of the artist’s original intentions.

game.name: 460 - Rockman 5 - Blues no Wana! (J) [!]
game.info: This is a recreation of Mega Man 9’s Endless Stage for Rockman 5. It is an endurance mode, screens are picked at random, you must get through them and reach a teleporter to move on to the next set of screens. Some of the screens are made from parts of the game’s original levels, some are completely original, and others are based on screens from previous Mega Man games. After so many screens you will face a boss. You start with all the master weapons and adapters in this hack, your only goal is to survive for as many screens as possible.

game.name: 462 - Dragon Warrior III (U) [!]
game.info: This patch has three noticeable effects:

game.name: 463 - Banana (J) [!]
game.info: Here’s a graphics hack of Banana that gives the original game a Lolo feel. Lolo and Lala must escape an unknown dimension that an unknown entity send them into.

game.name: 467 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Story

game.name: 469 - 1942 (JU) [!]
game.info: In 1919 we took a little trip across the great Atlantic, just to sink the titanic, No that was 1912. And yes for all mistakes and purposes we know world war 1 ended in the 1918 (cease-fire), with the peace treaty signed on June 28 1919. But just maybe we ripped it up and America said it’s their turn to invade Germany and stop Hitler before he comes to power thus preventing world war 2 from ever happening. Yeah right but anyway it’s a hack of 1942.

game.name: 472 - Captain Tsubasa Vol. II - Super Striker (J) [!]
game.description: Captain Tsubasa Vol. II - Super Striker (J) [!]
game.info: This is a cheaters edition of Captain Tsubasa 2:

patch.name: Captain Tsubasa Vol. II - Super Striker (J) [!].ips

rom.name: Captain Tsubasa Vol. II - Super Striker (J) [!].nes

game.name: 473 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: A complete graphic/level hack of Super Mario Bros. for the NES. Every character, enemy, and item have been changed into things from the Halo series. You control Master Chief as he searches for Cortana, who is being held in some Covenant stronghold!

game.name: 478 - Rockman 3 - Dr. Wily no Saigo! (J) [!]
game.info: Rockman 3 Endless is a recreation of Mega Man 9’s Endless Attack mode. It is an endurance mode; areas are picked at random, you start at a teleporter and must get to another teleporter at the end of the area. After so many screens you will face a robot master from the original game. You start the game with all of the robot masters’ weapons and Rush adapters; your only goal is to survive for as many screens as possible. A similar hack, by the same creator, is also available for Rockman 5.

game.name: 479 - Dragon Warrior IV (USA)
game.info: I’ve made this hack to be able to select any item in the game. You do so by pressing and holding select before you select your inventory. By doing this, you will access an alternate inventory. Every time you repeat the process you will access the next page. If you want to keep the current page, do the same, but press and hold start. To have the desired item in the real inventory, just select it with the A button. Then enter the inventory normally and you will have that item.

game.name: 487 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: VERSION 1.5 End of Level Block Bugs fixed… I think ;D

game.name: 504 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: Remember playing Metroid on your NES and putting in your password only to start playing with 6 empty energy tanks and 30 energy? This hack starts you off with your tanks FULL and at 99 energy!!

game.name: 509 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: This is a simple hack that gets rid of the annoying menu music, whenever you open the menu the normal music continues to play.

game.name: 52 - Megaman V (U) [!]
game.info: This ROM hack changes Mega Man into a little hero known as Cornfed the Monkey. Nearly all of the text in the game has been altered with a new storyline.

game.name: 524 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: This is a challenging SMB3 hack that includes quite a radical change in level and over-world designs, and a very slight change in graphic designs that don’t appear until later on in the game. Some people that have seen previews already think it’s a very difficult SMB3 hack. Some have even quoted it to be “deliciously evil” as well. It was created to attempt to break the more determined gamers out there. Whether or not it succeeds depends on the determination of those willing to try it.

game.name: 527 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Update: 1.0~rc1 - Offical Release Candidate

game.name: 53 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: This is a complete hack of Super Mario Bros 3, featuring 4 new worlds and 1 secret world! All worlds are filled with new levels, new graphics, new asm mods and more!

game.name: 531 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This is mostly a level hack of Super Mario Bros. with a bit of hex editing. It is somewhat harder than the original SMB1 (but not hard like Kaizo or Air).

game.name: 534 - Blaster Master (U) [!]
game.info: This hack changes (and in my opinion improves) the animation when you or your enemies take damage.

game.name: 535 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: A complete hack of SMB1 in which you play as the Sandman, who is on a quest to find the sand he uses to make people fall asleep, as he has lost them. He will travel through the realm of dreams, full of nightmares and fever dreams. This game is rather challenging and requires a lot of precise jumps and timing. Have fun!

game.name: 544 - Rockman 5 - Blues no Wana! (J) [!]
game.info: This is one of the most unique Megaman 5 hacks ever, created by the author of Rockman 2 Minimum. Many new features including…

game.name: 545 - Megaman (U) [!]
game.info: Mega Man Showdown IV is the boss-only version of Mega Man IV that makes all stages except for Cossack 1, and Cossack 2 only 2 screens. Wily 3 are where you re-fight old bosses.

game.name: 546 - Cross Fire (J)
game.info: This game had a small amount of engrish present in it and I cleaned it up. Kind of an average game and it appears to be a Metal Gear/Rambo rip-off where you go around the world fighting terrorists and blowing crap up.

game.name: 552 - Megaman III (U) [!]
game.info: Mega Man III Return changes the majority of the graphics from the original Mega Man III. Level design, enemy placement, and enemy resistances have also been altered in order to ramp up the difficulty, but there are no true modifications made to the AI.

game.name: 554 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: This is the sequel to Super Mario Bros Cube Root of 3 and this one is supposed to be even harder than Cube Root of 3 amongst other things. There are more difficult challenges and ambushes, more colorful backgrounds, more innovative ways to uncover newer things that are implemented in this one not in the previous one, even newer environments like weather simulators and specialized unique lands amongst other features. All 8 worlds are quite vast in comparison to areas in its prequel.

game.name: 555 - Wizardry - Proving Grounds of the Mad Overlord (U) [!]
game.description: Wizardry - Proving Grounds of the Mad Overlord (U) [!]
game.info: Wizardry is a dungeon-crawler RPG, ported to many platforms. Notorious for its difficulty, I’d still consider it one of the quintessential RPGs of the 1980’s.

patch.name: Wizardry - Proving Grounds of the Mad Overlord (U) [!].ips

rom.name: Wizardry - Proving Grounds of the Mad Overlord (U) [!].nes

game.name: 556 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: In this hack of SMB1, you play as Megaman.

game.name: 559 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This patch fixes the bugged out titlescreen in Strange Mario Bros.

game.name: 562 - Megaman IV (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: This is the first time Mike Vincent have tried to edit a game, and with zero programming skills it wasn’t easy. But with some help from MegaFLE X and Matrix, he was able to anyway. There are some KNOWN bugs in this hack, because of limited knowledge of ASM, he wasn’t able to fix everything.

game.name: 567 - Megaman IV (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: Complete new level designs, a few new graphics, and overall a new game to explore!

game.name: 573 - Rad Racer 2 (U) [!]
game.info: This hack makes it possible to play Rad Racer 2 without the need of extra name table VRAM for four-screen mirroring. The only drawback is that the backgrounds repeats each 256 pixels instead of each 512 pixels

game.name: 574 - Megaman III (U) [!]
game.info: This is a ROM hack of Capcom’s Mega Man III for the NES. All levels have been redesigned (including scrolling directions), a new title screen has been made, the color palettes have been changed, and some minor graphics have been edited. Other things are pretty much unchanged. The levels are harder than the ones in the original game. They’re designed to be hard enough to provide some challenge, but not so hard that the hack is not fun to play.

game.name: 599 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: An interesting hack where you star Princess Peach on your search for Mario. This hack combines graphics from Super Mario Bros. 2, Super Mario Bros. 3, Yoshi’s Island, and Kirby’s Dream Land. Jumping and the play control have been hacked as well and feel more consistent with Super Mario Bros. 2.

game.name: 62 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: What’s been changed:

game.name: 620 - Nuts & Milk (J) [!]
game.info: Gary’s Nuts is a Nuts & Milk hack by Googie and Quick Curly. Play as Gary to rescue Professor Oak and escape this weird dimension! The levels, music, sounds, and graphics have been changed along with a few minor ASM modifications. Please refer to the readme for more information.

game.name: 628 - Akumajou Densetsu (J) [!]
game.info: This hack adjust the Japanese version of Castlevania III to be playable on 50 Hz PAL consoles.

game.name: 629 - Guardian Legend, The (USA)
game.info: This is a substantial remix of the Guardian Legend. Designed for those who had mastered the original game and wanted to try another challenge. The game features completely new maps and shooter stages, several new boss fights, and a new final stage & final boss.

game.name: 63 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: This is a hack for Metroid. It improves the challenge level of the game considerably and alters the location of items and monsters. It also alters the layout of several areas in the game.

game.name: 636 - Soap Panic (Japan) (Unl)
game.info: Soap Panic is basically a Japanese edition of the Panesian game Bubble Bath Babes with a few different women pictured. Since these “adult” games for the old 8-bit NES system are commonly (and perhaps deservedly) mocked as a rather pointless exercise in appealing to the basest interests of the gamer, it comes as no surprise that no one previously seems to have noticed that the most commonly available ROM of Soap Panic is actually a bad dump.

game.name: 643 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This is a hack of Super Mario Bros. which is the sequel to TKB Super Mario Bros. It includes Lost Levels elements such as poison mushrooms and windy levels.

game.name: 653 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This SMB1 hack is the first of 10 SMB1 mini-hacks. It puts Mario in the Grassland World and he would then come face-to-face with Larry Koopa. This is the first ever complete SMB1 hack with a Koopaling in it instead of Bowser (he will appear in the last hack of this series).

game.name: 655 - Wai Wai World (J) [!]
game.info: The camera in Wai Wai World 1 would only move as the player approached the left/rightmost quarter of the screen. It was frustrating as it created many blind jumps.

game.name: 660 - Uninvited (U) [!]
game.info: Uninvited Uncensored

game.name: 663 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Super Mario Impossibros is a hack of Super Mario Bros with (some) different graphics, and harder levels. Most of the graphics and all of the levels have been hacked. If anything is the game has not been hacked, it is because the author (me) does not wish to change those aspects of the game for this hack.

game.name: 665 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: This is a complete, 5-world SMB3 hack originally started by Googie and majorly completed by Quick Curly. It is the sequel for Luigi’s Chronicles, a Super Mario Bros. hack.

game.name: 666 - Battle City (J) [!]
game.info: Simply put, in this Battle City hack, you play as an octorok and have to battle your way out of HELL!

game.name: 671 - Adventures of Lolo 2 (U) [!]
game.info: This is a new hack of The Adventures Of Lolo 2 game, created by me. It features new title/opening screens, 50 new levels, and 4 new PRO stages. Please read the short README before playing the game.

game.name: 673 - Megaman V (U) [!]
game.info: This is a Mega Man V hack that sets the game in Indonesia. All of the levels have been edited and some of the graphics have been altered. This hack is entirely in Indonesian. Happy gaming and sorry if you find bug in my hack! :)

game.name: 68 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: This is another Final Fantasy, mostly graphical, improvement hack. Some palettes have been edited as well as the text box borders. Overall, it’s not that bad.

game.name: 681 - Castlevania II - Simon's Quest (U) [!]
game.info: Yet another joke hack of Castlevania 2. When is there going to be a legitimate CV2 hack, dammit!

game.name: 688 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Just in time for Christmas is another short but sweet hack. You take on the role of Toadette who just had her Christmas morning ruined by a monster taking her Brother.

game.name: 693 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This is a new hack of Super Mario Bros. I only changed the levels and the titlescreen.

game.name: 7 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: This is Nightcrawler’s lame first hack made nearly 12 years ago! Thank goodness his skills have progressed since then!

game.name: 70 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: As of 2006, this is hailed as one of the greatest NES hacks of all time. This Super Mario Brothers 3 hack changes the game right down to the core by tweaking the actual game engine itself!

game.name: 71 - Super Dodge Ball (U) [!]
game.info: Plain and simply, this hack allows 4 players to play in “Bean Ball” mode.

game.name: 714 - 1943 - The Battle of Midway (U) [!]
game.info: This hack of 1943 changes the ship names to those in the arcade version/real life, and also includes a re-written intro, “fake ending,” and ending that is loosely based on the actual Battle of Midway from World War II.

game.name: 716 - Deadly Towers (U) [!]
game.info: This is an improvement hack that fixes the bat bug where it gets distorted when it flies to the right and it makes the area you start at colorful.

game.name: 728 - Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]
game.description: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]
game.info: A completely new Zelda II adventure!

patch.name: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!].ips

rom.name: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!].nes

game.name: 73 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: Final Fantasy 1X changes the appearances of the characters in battle and makes some of the useless weapons, armor, and magic better. It also gives the black belt/master class his own set of skills.

game.name: 731 - Rockman 5 - Blues no Wana! (J) [!]
game.info: This is a Rockman 5 hack with all levels have been redesigned. They’re designed to be hard enough to provide some challenge.

game.name: 735 - Castlevania II - Simon's Quest (U) [!]
game.info: This hack replaces the password options with simple Save and Load options. What it saves is the same information contained in a password.

game.name: 740 - Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]
game.description: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!]
game.info: Tested with the “Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U)”

patch.name: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!].ips

rom.name: Zelda II - The Adventure of Link (U) [!].nes

game.name: 746 - Mike Tyson's Punch-Out!! (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: Punch Out No TKO!(Hard Mode improvement hack)

game.name: 749 - Duck Tales (U) [!]
game.info: Specifically, that patch makes it so you only need to push A + B to do the pogo jump, instead of A + B + down.

game.name: 75 - Shadowgate (U) [!]
game.info: This is a simple 8×8 font improvement for Shadowgate on the 8-bit NES.

game.name: 753 - Faxanadu (J) [!]
game.info: In the original game, the pendant reduced attack power by 25% – this is because the pendant is “in effect” when you don’t have it. To clarify, it was a simple mistake, and a quick fix – changing a BNE to BEQ. Now you don’t start with the pendant effects and lose them when you pick up the actual pendant; you have the effects when you have the pendant!

game.name: 755 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: The game is a new version of Final Fantasy with increased challenge, new classes, new items, spells, and story. It is sort of a mixture of Final Fantasy I and an original fantasy setting. The readme file explains the new classes, the challenge can vary greatly based on your party. Most of the enemies have new graphics, and the ones that don’t do have new stats at least. There should be some fun twists and challenges, and there are 12 classes to pick from, right at the start, no class upgrade halfway through. It’s like Final Fantasy with a bizarre twist, but there are still swords, axes, magic, guns, airships, and stuff like that. Many of the graphics were modified sprites from other NES games or just outright pulled from them, so its kind of post-modern. 1.02 fixes the random encounter rate in the Serpent’s Tail dungeon. 1.07 fixes a few other minor bugs - battles that can’t be ran from, enemies not casting spells.

game.name: 756 - 2-in-1 - Donkey Kong Country 4 + Jungle Book 2 (Unl) [!]
game.info: All this really does is change the name to read ‘Donkey Kong Country’ without the ‘4′ because pirate companies often like to make their games look superior by adding all sorts of numbers to their titles.

game.name: 762 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: This is another little-known Final Fantasy patch, this time a retranslation and restoration of the original game! Now, there are other means of playing an uncut rendition of this game such as…well, Final Fantasy Origins, but this is for those who want to play through the original NES game. You’re one of those people, right?

game.name: 771 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: This is a slight challenge increase to the original Kid Icarus, with a few minor text and graphics changes for flavor. It’s my first attempt at hacking a platformer and forces the player to make use of the jump-duck technique more often. There are a few more pits and tricks, but not enough for me to call this a complete hack, especially since the only things changed in the fortress levels are a few of the enemy graphics.

game.name: 776 - Lode Runner (U) [!]
game.info: All 50 levels were redone. Compared to the original, this has better level progression. The original felt to hard for novices from the very beginning.

game.name: 777 - Megaman (U) [!]
game.info: This is a graphics hack for Mega Man 1.

game.name: 779 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: 8 all new levels with a good amount of difficulty. Shyguys and crabs have been added to the game along with a few other graphic changes.

game.name: 780 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: Ever wondered how characters from other games might fare on the quest of the LIGHT WARRIORS from Final Fantasy? Well, now you can form a party with Link, Mario, Mega Man, Samus, or several other transplants from odd places like a Holy Diver, Ghostbuster, Gundam, Namekian warrior, or Dodo bird. There are 12 classes to choose from in total, each with unique stats, abilities, equipment, and graphics. Very few enemies have been changed, but a few of the bosses were brought in from other games, to keep a few elements of surprise to the battles.

game.name: 781 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Super Mario Bros Rebirth is a complete SMB level hack that features 8 new wonderful worlds:

game.name: 789 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: This is a very comprehensive redesign of Final Fantasy 1.

game.name: 79 - Castlevania (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: This is an overhaul of the original Castlevania done using Stake, Tilelayer Pro & Hex Workshop. Many changes from the original have been made during the production of this hack. It took quite a while to complete, but the result was well worth the effort. All graphics of characters were done by me, bit-blade, moonchilde & revility. Bit-Blade & I also created the stage’s background graphics and Several changes involving the game’s engine were done through hexadecimal by me. Some of these changes include jumping higher & whip while walking (which is sort of a mixed blessing.), and the drop item ratio.

game.name: 790 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: Bowser has taken over Mushroom Land again! All the levels have been changed and have Bowser’s castle music playing. Most of the graphics have also been changed.

game.name: 796 - Legend of Zelda, The (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: Automap Plus adds a map to the overworld that is revealed as the player explores. Additional changes: the heart meter is drawn in 1/8 heart increments, and potions and fairies refill life faster.

game.name: 8 - Castlevania (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: Castlevania Remix is a hack of Castlevania which incorporates the use of a few simple tones for the palette in order to create a bit of a sepia/black-and-white quality to the game, which lends itself very well to Castlevania, making it look more like a silver-age era monster film, which is definitely where the idea for Castlevania originated. Some might scoff at the use of a palette like this, but making the graphics look this detailed on the NES with a small set of colors is no small feat.

game.name: 800 - Nekketsu Koukou Dodgeball-bu (Japan)
game.info: This patch converts Nekketsu Koukou Dodgeball Bu (NOT Super Dodge Ball) from Mapper 1 to Mapper 4.

game.name: 808 - Dizzy The Adventurer (Camerica) (Aladdin) [!]
game.info: This fixes the sound for Dizzy the Adventurer. Originally, the game reset the phase of each sound channel every frame, causing nasty scratching with the music. Now that problem is gone.

game.name: 81 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: Final Fantasy ++ (or Final Fantasy Double-Plus, or Final Fantasy Plus Plus) is a “re-imagining” of the very first Final Fantasy game.

game.name: 810 - Megaman III (U) [!]
game.info: This is a ROM hack of Capcom’s Mega Man III for the NES, which includes the following:

game.name: 811 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: The difficulty of this game starts off hard and gets extreme. About 1/3 of the levels are underwater. Lots of hidden pipes and power ups. Time to beat Bowser and save Mushroom Land again!

game.name: 817 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: ElSMB3, short for “ElBlocko’s SMB3″, is a complete overhaul of the original game in terms of level design and in-game text.

game.name: 82 - Bionic Commando (U) [!]
game.info: The original Japanese version of Bionic Commando (Hitler no Fukkatsu: Top Secret) underwent quite a bit of censoring before being released in English. Due to Nintendo’s strict censorship policies, all references to the Nazi Party, such as swastikas and the word “Nazi”, had been replaced with inoffensive material. This hack attempts to make the game be more like its Japanese counterpart. A few graphics have been switched, and the Badds are now Nazis. A few colors in the palette were darkened, too, as Nintendo felt it was necessary to brighten everything up a bit. Also, a few parts of the script were rewritten/corrected, which unfortunately includes a famous quote by a soldier in one of the neutral areas.

game.name: 822 - Duck Hunt (W) [!]
game.info: This hack is a joke, nothing more.

game.name: 825 - Megaman II (U) [!]
game.info: This is a Mega Man II hack that sets the game in Java Island, Indonesia. All of the levels have been edited, the graphics have been altered, and new adventure. This hack is entirely in Indonesian. Enjoy and sorry if you find bugs in my hack! :)

game.name: 826 - Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (U) [!]
game.info: This hack changes almost all of the levels for the NES game Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, everything except for the underwater section of Level 2. As well, some enemies hit points have been raised or lowered to make them a bit easier or harder, and some enemies do more damage when they hit you, too.

game.name: 829 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This is the second hack from HF Games, and the most important thing we wanted to accomplish was playability. The difficulty was made to be very comparable to the original Super Mario Bros, and this is a game you can pick up and play without needing to be a master of Super Mario Bros.

game.name: 83 - Castlevania II - Simon's Quest (U) [!]
game.info: A twisted, and very well done spoof of Castlevania 2. Basically, you play as a fellow named BBQ as he battles his whacko father. Almost every single sprite in the game appears to be changed, as well as all the text. In addition, many of the enemy and character sprites appear to be ripped from other games. Including such notables as Mario, the Contra guy, and Macho Man Randy Savage! Other oddities including day and nightime being reversed, and many of the undead from Castlevania 2 reappearing as townsfolk! This hack simply must be played!

game.name: 851 - Megaman II (U) [!]
game.info: This game is one of the hardest ROM hacks I’ve ever made. It’s very hard and challenging.

game.name: 859 - Airball (Unl) (Prototype2)
game.info: This changes the directional controls to match other NES games like Solstice, Snake Rattle ‘N Roll, and Bill & Ted’s.

game.name: 86 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: A complete and total conversion for Super Mario Bros, in which you star Toad. New levels, graphics, and even some small sound and ASM changes.

game.name: 860 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: Please note: This is a PRG0 hack, not a PGR1 hack. Patching PRG1 will cause the hack to crash on the ending! The readme also makes note of which version to use.

game.name: 861 - Megaman II (U) [!]
game.info: These patches will replace Mega Man with Proto Man in both the Mega Man II (U) and Rock Man 2 (J) ROM’s. It does not include any new levels or ASM tweaks.

game.name: 862 - Rockman (J) [!]
game.info: This patch will turn Japanese Rockman (Famicom) from UNROM (Mapper 2) to TNROM (Mapper 4 = MMC3). Created by dumping one game from “Rockman 1-6″ pirate cartridge, which is a compilation of all Rockman games hacked to MMC3.

game.name: 863 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: This patch will turn Japanese Rockman 2 (Famicom) from SGROM (Mapper 1) to TNROM (Mapper 4 = MMC3). Created by dumping one game from “Rockman 1-6″ pirate cartridge, which is a compilation of all Rockman games hacked to MMC3.

game.name: 868 - Castlevania II - Simon's Quest (U) [!]
game.info: This hack, done by The Almighty Guru, makes Simon’s Quest much more enjoyable by streamlining the gameplay and adding a few nice aesthetic touches. You now prossess Simon’s Redaction.

game.name: 87 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: A complete remake of Super Mario Bros, with new levels and graphics, in which you star Toad.

game.name: 870 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: Rockman L (Last) is a complete ROM hack based off of the Rockman 2 (J) ROM. It features all new robot masters, graphics, level design, and more!The music has also been rearranged to suite the new robot masters in the game. In short, it’s like playing an all-new Megaman/Rockman game!

game.name: 871 - Rockman 2 - Dr. Wily no Nazo (J) [!]
game.info: A complete hack of the Rockman 2 (J) ROM. Provides a real nice challenge compared to the original game and features all new level design, music, and graphics. One of the best hacks of 2009!

game.name: 872 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: Bowser has taken over Mushroom World and like always Mario has to save the day. SUICIDEXTREME2 has all new levels with a fair to extremely hard amount of difficulty.

game.name: 875 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Bowser has returned and kidnapped Yoshi! You must help Mario rescue his friends from the clutches of evil!

game.name: 88 - Castlevania III - Dracula's Curse (U) [!]
game.info: This patch fixes a small number of graphical oversights in Castlevania III. Most of these are related from reusing graphics from the first Castlevania game but forgetting to reorder two colors in their palette. Whether these are actually bugs is debatable, I made this patch for my own personal use but decided to release it publicly. The archive also includes a patch to use uncensored graphics in CV3 and a few patches for Akumajo Densetsu.

game.name: 880 - Castlevania II - Simon's Quest (U) [!]
game.info: A cosmetic enhancement patch for giving a “moody” look to Castlevania 2 Simon’s Quest (U).

game.name: 882 - Journey to Silius (U) [!]
game.info: Journey to Silius Plus aims to fix the known bugs and to make the game more attractive to players. The game itself is also a bit harder, so the players that have played Silius for a long time and know it well - may find it interesting.

game.name: 885 - Destiny of an Emperor (U) [!]
game.info: This mod aims to improve the gameplay of Destiny of an Emperor. Battles are designed to be more decisive, tipping in favor of the more powerful/smarter army much faster. Tactician heavy armies are designed to be more viable (and more necessary) over a long march. Difficulty is increased slightly, though several castle battles are designed to be rather nasty.

game.name: 889 - Megaman IV (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: Megaman came to Java Island, Indonesia several months ago, then met Kalinka and her father, Dr. Cossack in Tanah Abang, Jakarta. But, when Megaman came back to his hometown, a new problem began…

game.name: 890 - Wolverine (U) [!]
game.info: This hack makes the game a bit more forgiving by allowing some recovery time when you are damaged. Normally the game is without mercy and will drain your energy in seconds. The game is still challenging but should be within the ability of most players to complete now.

game.name: 895 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: This hack is a one world hack, filled with 28 new levels, 3 Power Up Pipes, and 2 different types of Mushroom Houses, and a Level Re-Do Spade “game”. There are TWO paths in this game, that allow the user to take control of his/her own destiny. The bottom path is the easiest, and the top path is very difficult. Both paths have their very own last levels, and both with their own Power Up Pipes. Take control of Mario and beat either path, or tackle both paths to bring the game to completion.

game.name: 896 - Ultima - Exodus (U) [!]
game.info: Ultima. A pioneering name in computer RPGs. A series that always has attempted to give a wide amount of leeway to players wanting to immerse themselves in a deep and engaging world. The emphasis of Ultima’s creators has always been the complexity of the game world (hence their slogan “We create worlds”). Character development, however, was not the forte of games in the series (especially up until Ultima Underworld).

game.name: 898 - Lei Dian Huang Bi Ka Qiu Chuan Shuo (NJ046) (Ch) [!]
game.description: Lei Dian Huang Bi Ka Qiu Chuan Shuo (NJ046) (Ch) [!]
game.info: Pokemon Yellow Music Hack by me, Lugia2009.

patch.name: Lei Dian Huang Bi Ka Qiu Chuan Shuo (NJ046) (Ch) [!].ips

rom.name: Lei Dian Huang Bi Ka Qiu Chuan Shuo (NJ046) (Ch) [!].nes

game.name: 899 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Are you tired of SMB hacks these days? All of them are too challenging, that they take the fun away. Looking for a hack that isn’t like that? Well, look no further! With all graphics changed, text changed, and new levels with the same difficulty as SMB, Supreme Mario Bros. is supreme to all other hacks!

game.name: 9 - Megaman II (U) [!]
game.info: This is a pretty large change of Mega Man 2. The main features include altered levels (altered both color wise and structure wise), altered colors (different enemy palettes, a altered sprites, and even a different storyline. Gamers should find the hack more challenging than the original Mega Man 2.

game.name: 90 - Final Fantasy II (J) [!]
game.info: There is a major flaw in Final Fantasy II’s experience system, you can gain experience with a weapon or spell by simply inputting a command and canceling your attack. This patch makes it so you will only gain experience for actual attacks.

game.name: 904 - Super Mario Bros. (World)
game.info: The 3rd part of the SUICIDEXTREME trilogy. All new levels with the complexity ranging from beginner to extreme. Scarce power ups, lot’s of secret pipes and hidden vines. Time to defeat Bowser and show him that he may be king of the koopa’s, but he’s not king of the Mario Bros!

game.name: 91 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: This hack changes the room layouts, enemy placements, and palettes in the original Metroid. Unfortunately the map and item placements have not been changed, so any person who knows where to go in the original game will know where to go in this hack.

game.name: 910 - Rockman 4 - Aratanaru Yabou!! (J) [!]
game.info: Made by talented ROM hacker: Puresabe, comes Rockman 4: Minus Infinity. One of the best ROM hacks that does what others only dream of achieving.

game.name: 912 - Castlevania II - Simon's Quest (U) [!]
game.info: This package includes a number of individual patches which are intended to improve some of the more annoying features of Castlevania II. The patches have been kept separate in order to make it easy for players to leave out any undesired changes.

game.name: 917 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: An original SMB3 game with the definition of a repeated level applied (i.e. new enemies, palettes, music, objects, level exits,and boss battles). This is Worlds 1 through 4 due to errors in testing a full ROM. World 5 through 8 will be on another ROM. My permission is granted for anyone to improve this hack.

game.name: 93 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: Hello there! You’re probably here because you’re looking for a fun hack of Super Mario Bros, right? If so, Super Mario Bros HF could be just for you. Perhaps the main focus of SMBHF is the difficulty. Most hacks that redo levels (at least the ones that I’ve tried) make the game nearly impossible! I’ve had quite a few games where I couldn’t get past the first few levels without savestates. In my opinion, games like these are just not fun. How can you enjoy a game if you have to keep saving after each major jump? I don’t think you can.

game.name: 938 - Adventures of Lolo 3 (U) [!]
game.info: Eggerland Mystery Remake is an almost complete replica of the original Eggerland Mystery, released in 1995 on the MSX. Most of the levels have been changed slightly in order to work properly, because on the MSX version, you could finish on the door, whereas Lolo finishes on the treasure chest, then the door.

game.name: 942 - Baseball Stars (U) [!]
game.info: Version 1.0 erases player portraits and updates men batters, field and scoreboard to graphics from Baseball Stars 2.

game.name: 943 - Baseball Simulator 1.000 (USA)
game.info: Baseball Simulator 2012 updates Culture Brain’s 1989 game Baseball Simulator 1.000 with current MLB rosters, colors and stats.

game.name: 945 - Final Fantasy (U) [!]
game.info: Final Fantasy Legend of the 7th King is a really hard hack that focus on patience and skill. Changes included:

game.name: 946 - Rockman 3 - Dr. Wily no Saigo! (J) [!]
game.info: Mega Man 3: Eons of Dreams Part 3 is a harder hack with fun levels, harder enemies, edited stats, and graphical changes. Take Mega Man to Snake Man pipe mazes, or you can try Top Man’s Forest!!

game.name: 947 - Megaman IV (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: Mega Man IV Eons of Dreams Part 4 is a harder hack then the original with:

game.name: 948 - Rockman 3 - Dr. Wily no Saigo! (J) [!]
game.info: Rockman Overdrive is a hack with decent challenge, fast paced action, and good replay value. You can choose to explore Top Man’s Ice World or Magnet Man’s Robot Factory!!

game.name: 95 - Castlevania II - Simon's Quest (U) [!]
game.info: An extensive graphics and text hack of Castlevania 2, with a couple surprises as well. Here’s a complete list of all the changes, straight from the readme (included with the zip file):

game.name: 955 - Castlevania (U) (PRG1) [!]
game.info: Castlevania - Prelude Of Darkness (Collection)

game.name: 958 - Blaster Master (U) [!]
game.info: A complete level hack for Blaster Master (NES) featuring 8 new tank levels!

game.name: 959 - Megaman III (U) [!]
game.info: Dr. Wily chose Indonesia for his next evil plan. He went to Palangkaraya, Borneo to build a central base and sent his robot masters to many areas in Indonesia. He also went to handicraft museum in Jakarta Raya and damaged an Indonesian artifact then took its material for complement his evil creation.

game.name: 96 - Metroid (U) [!]
game.info: Straight from the readme:

game.name: 960 - Super Mario Bros. 3 (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: This is the sequel to NEW Super Mario Bros 3 (1988). Same rules apply from the previous installment. The rule of a repeated level returns to these games. Also, some of my custom levels I have made when I began SMB3 level making and some from a recent set and one showcase level has made it into part 2. Speaking of which, same format as NSMB31988. Part 1, 2, and lost levels. Enjoy!

game.name: 963 - Moai-kun (J)
game.info: Demons from an unknown dimension came and stole Luigi’s cherry stash, no one takes Luigi’s stash! So Luigi goes into their dimension & get what’s his!

game.name: 965 - Destiny of an Emperor (U) [!]
game.info: Use FCE Ultra to play this mod! Otherwise portrait and sprite graphics may not show up. Download FCE Ultra here.

game.name: 97 - Legend of Zelda, The (U) (PRG0) [!]
game.info: Timecrisis: Fall of the Moon is an extensive hack of the original Legend of Zelda, changing the maps, graphics, and storyline. The storyline and a short walkthrough can be found in the readme.

game.name: 975 - Rockman 4 - Aratanaru Yabou!! (J) [!]
game.info: Creates effects for enemy hex numbers F0 - F5. IPS patch applies to Rockman 4. Source code provided! Best when making Mega Man IV / Rockman 4 hacks.

game.name: 98 - Rockman (J) [!]
game.info: Kuwata’s first hack of Rockman (1). It features new levels, graphics, enemies, and even music. The levels are very challenging; some even have small puzzles in them.

game.name: 981 - Rockman 4 - Aratanaru Yabou!! (J) [!]
game.info: Creates the behind the wall TSA block in slot E in your Mega Man IV / Rockman 4 map editor when making levels. The original coding was created from Rock5easily but code placed in the existing slot which glitches after the Cossack 4 fight. This modified coding is placed in an unused data entry.

game.name: 986 - Super Mario Bros. (W) [!]
game.info: This hack was released the same day Luigi’s Chronicles was released, but wasn’t very popular because Luigi’s Chronicles was popular. I was going through my ROM Hack folder and found this hack, so there you have it.

game.name: 992 - Rockman 3 - Dr. Wily no Saigo! (J) [!]
game.info: This is an improvement patch for Mega Man III/Rockman 3. It has many improvements to the game + MANY bugfixes that existed originally in MM3.

game.name: 994 - Destiny of an Emperor (U) [!]
game.info: Massive game play improvements over the original Destiny of an Emperor:

game.name: 997 - Castlevania (Europe)
game.info: PROBABLY OBSOLETE: SEE CASTLEVANIA “PRINCE OF DARKNESS” HACK INSTEAD.

game.name: 999 - Earthbound Zero by Demiforce v1.01-1 (Hack)
game.info: This is an IPS patch that removes the “Zero” in the unreleased English NES prototype “Earth Bound”.
